何以言之？如今人之气禀薄弱者，无论少壮，或于劳倦，或于酒色之后，每忽有耳鸣如磬，或头眩眼黑，倏顷而止者，乃人所常有之事。至于中年之外，多见眩仆卒倒等证，亦人所常有之事。但忽运而忽上者，人皆谓之头运眼花；卒倒而不醒者，人必谓之中风中痰。不知忽止者，以气血未败，故旋见而旋止，即小中风也；卒倒而甚者，以根本既亏，故遽病而难复，即大头眩也。且必见于中年之外，而较之少壮，益又可知。于此察之，则其是风非风，是痰非痰，而虚实从可悟矣。何今人不识病机，但见眩仆不语等证，无不谓之风痰，而非消即散，吾恐几微之气，有不堪再加铲削矣。深可悲也。[169p]

How can it be explained? Nowadays, people with weak constitutions, regardless of age, whether young or old, after fatigue or indulging in wine and pleasure, often experience ringing in the ears like a bell, or dizziness with blurred vision, which quickly subsides; this is a common occurrence. Beyond middle age, one often observes symptoms such as fainting and collapse, which are also quite common. However, when these symptoms appear and disappear suddenly, people generally call it "head disturbance with blurred vision"; if someone collapses and does not regain consciousness, it is often attributed to "stroke or phlegm." They fail to realize that the temporary cessation is due to the qi and blood not being completely depleted, hence it appears and disappears quickly, which is a mild form of stroke; but a severe collapse indicates a fundamental deficiency, resulting in sudden illness that is hard to recover from, which is a serious form of dizziness. Moreover, such symptoms are typically seen in those beyond middle age, and compared to the young, the severity is even more evident. Observing this, one can discern whether it is truly wind or not, whether it is phlegm or not, and understand the dynamics of deficiency and excess. Why do people nowadays not recognize the underlying mechanisms of these ailments, and merely see dizziness and collapse without speaking of them, attributing it all to wind and phlegm without considering that it may be dissipative or dispersive? I fear that the slightest decline in qi may be subjected to further burdens. It is deeply lamentable.[169p]

　　　　　论治

　　头眩虽属上虚，然不能无涉于下。盖上虚者，阳中之阳虚也；下虚者，阴中之阳虚也。阳中之阳虚者。宜治其气，如四君子汤、五君子煎、归脾汤、补中益气汤；如兼呕吐者，宜圣朮煎，大加人参之类是也。　　阴中之阳虚者，宜补其精，如五福饮、七福饮、左归饮、右归饮、四物汤之类是也。　　然伐下者必枯其上，滋苗者必灌其根。所以凡治上虚者，犹当以兼补气血为最，如大补元煎、十全大补汤、及诸补阴补阳等剂，俱当酌宜用之。　　眩运证，凡有如前论首条所载病源者，当各因其证求而治之。[170p]

Discussion on Treatment

Dizziness, though related to an upper deficiency, cannot be entirely separated from the lower. The upper deficiency refers to the ultimate yang weakness; the lower deficiency pertains to the yang weakness within yin. For ultimate yang weakness, one should treat the qi, using formulas like the Four Gentlemen Decoction, the Five Gentlemen Brew, the Gui Pi Decoction, or the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction. In cases with accompanying vomiting, the Sheng Jiang Decoction with an increase in ginseng and similar ingredients should be applied.

For the yang weakness within yin, one should supplement the essence, using formulas like the Five Blessings Drink, the Seven Blessings Drink, the Left Return Drink, the Right Return Drink, or the Four Substance Decoction. It is essential to understand that depleting the lower will inevitably harm the upper, and nourishing the sprouts must involve watering the roots. Therefore, in treating upper deficiency, it is still crucial to also supplement qi and blood, using formulas like the Major Tonifying Yuan Decoction, the Ten Perfect Tonifying Soup, and various formulas for replenishing yin and yang, all should be used judiciously.

For cases of dizziness, any underlying sources of illness as mentioned in the previous discussion should be treated according to their specific symptoms.[170p]

其或有火者，宜兼清火；有痰者，宜兼清痰；有气者，宜兼顺气。亦在乎因机应变。然无不当以治虚为先，而兼治为佐也。　　古法之治眩运，亦有当察者。丹溪曰：湿痰者多，宜二陈汤，火者加酒芩。挟气虚者相火也，治痰为先，挟气药降火，如东垣半夏白朮天麻汤之类。　　眩运不可当者，以大黄酒炒为末，茶汤调下。　　火动其痰，用二陈，加黄芩、苍朮、羌活散风行湿。附录曰：有早起眩运，须臾自定，日以为常者，正元散，下黑锡丹。　　伤食头运，肾着汤加川芎，名除湿汤。　　有痰者，青州白丸子。
　　愚谓古法之治眩运，如半夏白朮天麻汤，治脾痰也。二陈汤加黄芩，治热痰也。青州白丸，治风痰寒痰也。肾着汤，治肾痰也。此外如大黄末之治眩运不可当，惟痰火上壅者宜之。黑钖丹之重坠，惟气实于上者宜之。第恐眩运一证，实痰实火者无几，而亦非上盛之病。此古方之有宜否用者，不可不审。[171p]

If there is fire, one should also clear the fire; if there is phlegm, one should clear the phlegm; if there is qi, one should regulate the qi. This depends on the situation and must adapt accordingly. However, it is always important to prioritize treating deficiency and complement this with addressing other issues.

In the ancient methods for treating dizziness and vertigo, careful observation is necessary. Danxi stated that for those with damp phlegm, the Erchen decoction should be used, and for fire, it should be combined with wine and Huangqin. Those with both qi deficiency and fire require first treating the phlegm while using qi-regulating herbs to reduce fire, such as the Dongyuan Banxia Baizhu Tianma decoction.

For dizziness that cannot be resisted, prepare a powder of Dahuang stir-fried in wine and take it with tea infusion. When fire stirs phlegm, use Erchen decoction and add Huangqin, Cangzhu, and Qianghuo to dispel wind and eliminate dampness.

It is noted that if there is early morning dizziness that stabilizes shortly and occurs as a daily routine, one should use Zhengyuan powder and Xiaheixidan.

For food injury causing dizziness, add Chuanxiong to the Shen Zhuo decoction, named Chushi decoction. Those with phlegm should use Qingzhou Baowanzi.

I believe the ancient method for treating dizziness, such as the Banxia Baizhu Tianma decoction, treats spleen phlegm. The Erchen decoction with Huangqin treats heat phlegm. The Qingzhou Baowan treats wind phlegm and cold phlegm. The Shen Zhuo decoction treats kidney phlegm. Additionally, the use of Dahuang powder for dizziness is suitable only for phlegm-fire obstruction. The heavy fall from Heixidan is suitable only when qi is abundant above. However, one should be cautious, as cases of dizziness may involve substantial phlegm and fire, but are not solely due to excessive conditions above. It is essential to carefully assess whether these ancient formulas are appropriate for use.[171p]

　　　　石室秘箓 【清　陈士铎】

　　　　　头痛治法

　　常治法者，谓以常法而治之者也。如人病头疼，则以头疼常法治之是也。何必头疼而治之于两足乎？虽头疼实有治之两足而愈者，然彼必常治之而不愈，然后以变法治之，非可以舍常法而先求之于变法也。故一遇头疼，即以川芎五钱，白芷、蔓荆子、甘草、半夏、细辛各一钱治之，病去如扫也。　　上治者，治上焦之证也。如头疼而风入太阳经也。用川芎、细辛、白芷、柴胡、半夏、甘草各一钱，芍药三钱治之。盖风虽犯太阳，治法不可全治太阳，当上清其邪。故用白芷、川芎、细辛三味以散之；又用白芍、甘草、柴胡、以清肝胆之火，胆经与肝经入于头络，故用此数味以散邪去火；又加半夏去痰，甘草和中，相济而有成也。又头痛一方，用川芎一两，蔓荆子二钱，水煎服立愈。[172p]

Secret Manuscript of the Stone Chamber: Treatment for Headaches

The common method of treatment is to address the condition according to established practices. For example, if a person suffers from a headache, one should use the typical treatments for headaches. There is no need to treat it by addressing the feet, even if there are cases where treating the feet may lead to relief; however, one must generally use established methods first before attempting alternative treatments. Therefore, when a headache arises, take five qian of Chuanxiong, one qian each of Baizhi, Manjingzi, Licorice, Banxia, and Xixin, and the ailment will be dispelled instantly.

For upper treatments, which address issues with the upper burner, such as headaches caused by wind invading the Taiyang channel, use one qian each of Chuanxiong, Xixin, Baizhi, Chaihu, Banxia, and Licorice, along with three qian of Shaoyao. Although wind affects the Taiyang, the treatment need not entirely focus on it; the key is to clear the evil. Thus, Baizhi, Chuanxiong, and Xixin are used to disperse the wind, while Baishao, Licorice, and Chaihu help clear the fire from the liver and gallbladder, as these channels connect to the head. Additionally, Banxia is included to eliminate phlegm, and Licorice harmonizes the ingredients together to achieve efficacy.

As another remedy for headaches, use one liang of Chuanxiong and two qian of Manjingzi, decoct in water and drink to achieve immediate relief.[172p]

盖川芎补血，蔓荆子去风也。　　完治者，如病头疼脑痛，不必支刀破囫囵而治之也。头痛用黄酒一升，入细辛一两，白芷一两，煮酒，一醉而愈。　　此等治法，世人不知，亦不敢用，今为开导之。头痛至终年累月，其邪深入于脑，可知一二钱之散药，安能上至巅顶，而深入于脑中？必多用细辛、川芎、白芷以大散之也。或疑散药太多，必损真气，恐头痛未除而真气先行散尽。谁知风邪在头，非多用风药，必难成功。有病则病受之，何畏哉？一醉而愈。此方信而不必疑者也。惟是既愈之后，必须用熟地、芍药、当归各五钱，川芎一钱，山茱萸、麦门冬各三钱，水煎服四剂为妙。　　如人病头痛者，人以为风在头，不知非风也，亦肾水不足而邪火冲入于脑，终朝头运，似头痛而非头痛也。[173p]

Chuanxiong nourishes the blood, and Manjingzi dispels wind. For those who treat ailments, such as headaches, there is no need to resort to drastic measures. For headache relief, use one liter of yellow wine, add one tael of Xixin and one tael of Bai Zhi, and brew it to intoxication for a cure.

These treatment methods are unknown to most, and few dare to use them; hence I provide guidance today. When headaches persist for years, the evil is deeply rooted in the brain. How can a few cents' worth of powdered medicine reach the crown and penetrate into the brain? You must use ample Xixin, Chuanxiong, and Bai Zhi to disperse it effectively. Some may fear that using too many herbs will deplete genuine qi, worried that the headache won't go away before the genuine qi runs out. When someone suffers from a headache, they often believe it to be wind in the head, not recognizing it could also be due to insufficient kidney water, allowing evil fire to surge into the brain, causing what seems like a headache but is not truly one.[173p]

若只治风，则痛更甚。法当大补肾水，而头痛头运自除。方用熟地、葳蕤各一两，山茱萸四钱，北五味、麦冬各二钱，元参、川芎、当归、山药各三钱，二剂即愈。此方妙在治肾而不治风，尤妙在治肾而兼治肝也。肝木不平，则肺金失化源之令，而肾水愈衰。今补肝又补肾，子母相资，自然上清头目。况又入麦冬、五味，以滋肺金之清肃乎？所以下喉即安然也。　　头痛有神方，用川芎、沙参各一两，蔓荆二钱，细辛五钱，水二碗，煎八分，加黄酒半碗，调匀早晨服之，一剂永不再疼。此方妙在用沙参，盖沙参补阴，原不入脑，今用于川芎之中，而蔓荆、细辛，直走于巅，则沙参不能下行，不得不同群共入于脑中。夫脑痛者，因脑阴之虚风，得留之而不去。[174p]

Treating only the wind will exacerbate the pain. The method should primarily strengthen the kidney water, and the headache will naturally resolve. The formula includes one tael each of cooked rehmannia and astragalus, four qian of cornelian cherry, two qian each of northen five-flavor fruit and ophiopogon, and three qian each of radix scrophulariae, ligusticum, angelica, and yam; just two doses will cure it. 今补其脑则风不能存，而脑痛自愈，而头痛亦除矣。此方不特治头痛，兼治脑疼，无不神效。　　头痛之证，止消用蓖麻子一粒捣碎，同枣肉些须同捣匀，丸如黄豆大，外用丝绵裹之，纳入鼻孔，少顷必有清涕流出，即将丸药取出，不可久放其中，头疼即愈，永不再发。倘久留在中，必致脑髓流出，又成不可药救之证，切记切记！　　如人头疼，法当用轻清之口，少少散之，无不立效，如小柴胡汤之方是也。然而小柴胡汤，世人不知轻重之法，予再酌定之，可永为式。方用柴胡、黄芩、半夏、甘草各一钱，人参五分，此小柴胡汤。予更加人参五分，茯苓二钱，更为奇妙，盖气足则邪易出而汗易发。世人见用人参，便加失色，匪独医者不敢用，即病者亦不敢服，相沿而不可救药者，滔滔皆是。安得布告天下医人，详察其病源而善用之也！[175p]

Now, if you apply this remedy to the brain, the wind will not be able to remain, and the pain in the brain will heal on its own, and the headache will also be relieved. This method not only treats headaches but also addresses brain pain, with no exception of efficacy.

　　　　　脑痛治法

　　脑痛，用黄酒一升，白勺三两，辛夷、桔梗各三钱，(木郁)李仁、麦冬、柴胡各五钱，甘草一钱，水三碗，煎汤，入前酒饮之，一醉而愈。量好者再饮之以酒，必以醉为度。　　脑痛之病，乃风入胆经也。胆应于脑，故脑痛。人以为用柴胡太多，过于辛散，不知有白芍和之，则不散气而转能散邪。辛夷、(木郁)仁皆入胆之妙品，桔梗、甘草又入肺之妙药。胆病何以又兼治肺？不知鼻上通于脑，脑热则必下流清水，久则必成鼻渊矣。兼治其肺，则肺气清肃，自去平胆木之旺，而清涕不致下行。此立方之神妙有如此。[176p]

Treatment for Head Pain

For head pain, use one liter of yellow wine, three taels of white spoon (a type of herb), three qian each of magnolia flower and platycodon, five qian each of (wood) plum pits, dwarf lilyturf, and bupleurum, one qian of licorice, and three bowls of water. Prepare it as a decoction, then add the yellow wine and drink it; one bout of drunkenness will cure it. If the dosage is correct, drink again with wine, ensuring it leads to drunkenness.

Head pain arises from wind entering the gallbladder meridian. Since the gallbladder is connected to the brain, that is why there is head pain. Some believe that using too much bupleurum is overly dispersive, not realizing that white peony can harmonize it, preventing the Qi from dispersing while still allowing the dispelling of pathogens. Magnolia flower and (wood) plum pits are excellent for the gallbladder, while platycodon and licorice are wonderful medicines for the lungs. How can gallbladder issues also treat the lungs? It is not understood that the nose connects to the brain; when the brain is hot, it must lead to a flow of clear fluids, which if prolonged, will lead to nasal congestion. This is the marvelous efficacy of this prescription.[176p]

　　　　　头面肿

There is a treatment for scabby heads using dozens of snails. Wash the scabby head with them, and after two applications, it will surely heal; this is also a miraculous remedy. Three bowls of water are sufficient to boil thirty snails.[177p]

　　　　　头角生疮

　　如人有头角生疮，当日即头重如山，第二日即变生青紫，第三日青至身上即死，此乃毒气攻心而死也。此病多得之好吃春药。盖春药之类，不过一丸，食之即强阳善战，非用大热之药，何能致此？世间大热之药，无过附子与阳起石之类是也。二味俱有大毒，且阳起石必须火煅而后入药，是燥干之极，自然克伐津液，况穷工极巧于妇女博欢，则筋骸气血俱动，久战之后，必大泄尽情，水去而火益炽矣。久之贪欢必然结成大毒，火气炎上，所以多发在头角太阳之部位也。初起之时，若头重如山，便是此恶证，急不待时，速以金银花一斤煎汤，饮之数十碗，可少解其毒，可保性命之不亡，而终不能免其疮口之溃烂也。再用金银花、元参各三两，当归二两，生甘草一两，煎汤，日用一剂，服至七日，疮口始能收敛而愈。此种病世间最多，而人最不肯忌服春药也，痛哉！[178p]

Comprehensive Collection of Ancient and Modern Books: Complete Record of Medical Volume 125

Head Disorders

Formulas

Juqing's Ancient Dispersing Powder (found in the "Zhong Zang Jing") - treats head wind and blood wind.
Ingredients: One pound of schizonepeta spike, half a pound of dried chrysanthemum flowers, two taels of roasted white atractylodes, four taels of chuanxiong.
All ingredients are to be ground finely together; take two qian mixed with tea after meals.

Erwu Pills - treats wind phlegm and dizziness.
Ingredients: Four taels each of chuanwu, caowu, and qingyan, half a sheng of black beans.
Combine with two sheng of water, boil the four ingredients; replenish with warm water as the quantity reduces. Once the chuanwu becomes slightly soft, crush all ingredients together; continue boiling until thoroughly cooked. Remove skins and cook together.
Crush the chuanwu and black beans in a stone or wooden mortar until very fine and free of white specks, then form into pills. When dry, add medicinal water to moisten and crush again; during boiling, reserve under one cup of water for replenishment - do not let it boil dry.
Form pills the size of a walnut; take three to twenty pills with salt liquor or salty soup, as needed, before meals.[179p]

　　鸱头丸 【《圣惠方》】 　治头风眩运。　　鸱头一枚，炒黄　真(艹闾)茹　白朮各一两　川椒半两，炒去汗　右为末，蜜和丸梧子大，每酒下二十丸。
　　松花酒 【《奇效良方》】 　治风头旋脑皮肿痹。　　松花并台春三月取五六寸如鼠尾者，不拘多少　右蒸细切，一升，用生绢囊贮，以酒三升，浸五日，每日空心暖饮五合，晚食再服。
　　桂枝芍药知母汤 【仲景，下同】 　治中风头眩，短气温温欲吐者。　　桂枝　知母　防风各四两　芍药三两　甘草　麻黄　附子炮各二两　白朮　生姜各五两　右九味，以水七升煮取二升，温服七合，日三服。
　　甘草干姜汤　治肺中冷头眩多涎唾。　　甘草四两炙　干姜二两炮　右(口父)咀，以水三升，煮取一升五合，去滓分，温再服。[180p]

Chitou Pill (from "Shenghui Fang")
Used to treat head wind and dizziness.
One Chitou, stir-fried until yellow; 1 tael of Zhenru, White Atractylodes, and half a tael of Sichuan Pepper, stir-fried to remove sweat. Grind to a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of a wutong seed. Take twenty pills with wine.

Songhua Wine (from "Qixiao Liangfang")
Used to treat wind-induced headaches and swelling of the brain skin.
Collect Songhua in March, taking those 5-6 inches long like a mouse tail; quantity doesn't matter. Steam and finely chop to yield 1 liter. Store in a silk sack, soak in 3 liters of wine for five days. Drink 500 ml warm on an empty stomach daily, and take again after evening meals.

Gui Zhi Shao Yao Zhi Mu Decoction (Zhongjing, same below)
Used to treat stroke-induced dizziness, shortness of breath, warmth, and nausea.
Four taels of Cinnamon Twig, Zhi Mu, and Fang Feng; three taels of Peony Root; two taels each of Licorice, Ephedra, and Aconite (prepared); five taels each of White Atractylodes and Fresh Ginger. These nine ingredients are boiled in seven liters of water to yield two liters. Warm and take 700 ml, three times a day.

Licorice and Dried Ginger Decoction
Used to treat cold in the lungs, dizziness, and excessive salivation.
Four taels of roasted Licorice and two taels of prepared Dried Ginger, chew finely. Use three liters of water, boil to reduce to 1.5 liters, strain, and take warm.[180p]

　　苓桂朮甘汤　治痰饮。胸胁支满目眩。　　茯苓四两　桂枝　白朮各三两　甘草二两　右四味，以水六升，煮取三升，分温三服。小便则利。
　　半夏加茯苓汤　治卒呕吐，心下痞，膈间有水眩悸者。　　半夏一升　生姜半斤　茯苓三两，一方四两　右三味，以水七升，煮取一升五合，分温再服。
　　文蛤散　治微风头痛。
　　文蛤五两　右一味杵为散，以沸汤五合，和服方寸匕。
　　茵陈蒿汤　治谷疸头眩。
　　茵陈蒿六两　栀子十四枚　大黄二两　右三味，以水一斗先煮茵陈，减六升，内二味，煮取三升，去滓，分温三服。小便当利，尿如皂角汁状，色正赤，一宿腹减，黄从小便去也。
　　硝石矾石散　治女劳疸身尽黄，额上黑。　　硝石　矾石烧，等分　右二味为散，以大麦粥汁，和服方寸匕，日三服。病随大小便去，小便正黄，大便正黑，是候也。[181p]

Pingui Zhugantang treats phlegm and fluid retention, chest and side fullness, and dizziness.
Ingredients: 4 taels of Poria, 3 taels each of Cinnamon Twig and White Atractylodes, and 2 taels of Licorice. Boil these four ingredients in 6 sheng of water until reduced to 3 sheng, divide into three warm doses. It will promote urination.

Banxia Jia Fuling Tang treats sudden vomiting, distention under the heart, and water retention causing dizziness and palpitations.
Ingredients: 1 sheng of Pinellia, 0.5 jin of fresh ginger, 3 taels of Poria, and 4 taels of another formula. Boil these three ingredients in 7 sheng of water until reduced to 1 sheng and 5 xiao, divide into two warm doses.

Wenhansan treats mild wind headache.
Ingredients: 5 taels of Wenhans (a type of clam), ground into powder. Mix with 5 xiao of boiling water and take with a spoonful.

Yinchenhao Tang treats jaundice with dizziness.
Ingredients: 6 taels of Yinchenhao, 14 pieces of Gardenia fruit, and 2 taels of Rhubarb. Boil Yinchenhao in 10 dou of water first, then reduce by 6 sheng, add the other two ingredients, boil down to 3 sheng, strain, and divide into three warm doses. Urination should be plentiful, with urine resembling soap pod juice, red in color. After one night, the abdomen should reduce, and the yellow will be expelled through urine.

Xiaoshi Fanshi San treats the jaundice of women with total黄 (yellowing) and black on the forehead.
Ingredients: Equal parts of Saltpeter and Alum burnt to ash. Make into powder and mix with barley porridge juice, taking with a spoonful, three times a day. The illness will follow the urination and defecation; proper yellow in urine and black in stool is the sign of progress.[181p]

　　小柴胡汤
　　柴胡半斤　半夏半升　黄芩　人参　甘草　生姜各三两　大枣十二枚　右七味，以水一斗二升，煮取六升，去滓，再煎取三升，温服一升，日三服。

　　治风寒湿在脑头痛眩运呕吐，及眉棱眼眶痛。　　川芎三钱　细辛　白朮各一钱半　甘草一钱　右銼，作一贴，入生姜五片，茶芽少许，水煎服。
　　川芎散 【《纲目》，下同】 　治偏头痛神效。　　甘菊　石膏　川芎　白僵蚕生各六钱　右为细末，每三钱，茶清调下。
　　玉真丸　《内经》曰：头痛巅疾，下虚上实，过在足少阴巨阳，甚则入肾。许学士曰：肾厥头痛也，此药主之。　　硫黄二两　石膏煅　半夏制　硝石各一两　右为末，姜汁糊和丸梧子大，阴干，每二三十丸，姜汤或米饮下。[182p]

Xiao Chaihu Decoction
Half a pound of Chaihu, half a sheng of Banxia, three taels each of Huangqin, Renshen, Gancao, and Shengjiang, and twelve jujubes; these seven ingredients are combined with twelve liters of water, boiled down to six liters, strained, and then boiled again to obtain three liters. The decoction is taken warm, one liter at a time, three times daily.

Fuling Guizhi Baizhu Gancao Decoction
Four taels of Fuling, two taels each of peeled Guizhi, Baizhu, and roasted Gancao; these four ingredients are combined with six liters of water, boiled down to three liters, strained, and divided into three warm doses.

Xiao Qiongxin Decoction
Treats headaches caused by wind, cold, and dampness, as well as nausea and pain around the eyes. Three qian of Chuanqiong, one and a half qian each of Xixin and Baizhu, and one qian of Gancao are ground into a fine powder, combined with five slices of Shengjiang and a small amount of tea buds, then decocted and consumed.

Chuanqiong Powder
Highly effective for treating migraines. Six qian each of Gancao, Juhua, Shigao, and Chuanqiong are ground into a fine powder; three qian of this powder is taken in hot tea.

Yuzhen Pill
The Inner Classic states: Headaches at the vertex indicate deficiency below and excess above, often affecting the lesser yin and greater yang channels and severely entering the kidneys. Scholar Xu indicates that kidney obstruction causes head pain, and this medicine addresses it. Two taels of sulfur, one tael each of calcined gypsum, processed Banxia, and nitre are ground into a fine powder, mixed with ginger juice to form pills the size of walnuts, air-dried, and taken in groups of two to thirty with ginger soup or rice gruel.[182p]

　　川芎　石膏各等分　右剉水煎服。

　　一字轻金散　治偏正头风痛，夹脑风眉棱骨痛，牵引两眼，抽掣疼痛，迸出或生翳膜，视物不明。　　川芎　白芷　藿香　荆芥　旋覆花　石膏　防风各五钱　南星　川乌生，各二钱半　草乌一钱半　右銼细，共捣为末，每一字，茶清调下，神效。偏头一边痛，鼻塞不闻香臭，服此药数次，嚏出一铤稠脓，即愈。[183p]

Chuanxiong Shigao Decoction: Treats heat-induced syncope and headaches.
Equal parts Chuanxiong and Shigao, ground and decocted in water for consumption.

Heqi Powder: Treats wind-cold headaches and sudden blood wind attacks in women.
Dried, tender stems of Cang'er, powdered and taken with two qian (a unit of weight) in wine. This medicine effectively reaches the crown of the head and is good for unblocking the vertex; both powdered and decocted forms are effective.

Chuanxiong Tea Adjusting Powder: Treats both lateral and central headaches, and headaches with nasal congestion and heavy voice.
Two liang of mint, one liang each of Chuanxiong and Jingjiao, five qian each of Qianghuo, Baizhi, and Licorice; two and a half qian each of Fangfeng and Xixin, ground to a powder. Take two qian after meals with tea; alternatively, take seven qian to make a poultice and decoct with a little tea, which is also effective. For lateral headaches, take fine powder and mix with onion juice to apply to the temples for immediate effect.

One Character Light Gold Powder: Treats unilateral and bilateral headache, pain in the bones of the forehead and eyebrows, pulling pain in the eyes, spasmodic pain, leading to blurry vision or the formation of membranes.
Five qian each of Chuanxiong, Baizhi, Huoxiang, Jingjiao, and Xuanfu flower, five qian of Shigao, two and a half qian each of Nansheng and Chuanwu, and one and a half qian of Caowu, ground finely, mixed thoroughly. Take one character’s worth, dissolved in tea, for miraculous effects. Lateral headache with nasal congestion and inability to smell scents; after taking this medicine several times, expel a thick, foul discharge, and then be cured.[183p]

　　白附子散　治风寒入脑，令脑逆头痛齿亦痛，或牵引两眼，遂至失明。　　白附子一两　麻黄留节　川乌　南星各五钱　全蝎五个　干姜　朱砂　麝香各二钱半　右为末，温酒调五分服，服讫去枕，卧少时，效。

Bai Fuzhi Powder: Treats wind-cold entering the brain, causing reverse headaches, and tooth pain, or pulling at both eyes, which may lead to blindness. Ingredients: 1 ounce of Bai Fuzhi, 5 qian each of Ma Huang, Liu Jie, Chuan Wu, and Nan Xing, 5 whole scorpions, 2.5 qian each of dried ginger, cinnabar, and musk. Grind into powder, mix with warm wine, take five fen, after taking remove the pillow and lie down for a short time, and it will be effective.

Shangqing Bai Fuzhi Pill: Treats strong phlegm and wind, headache, dizziness, feeling of rotation, nausea, and clouded spirit. Regular use eliminates wind, transforms phlegm, and clears the head and eyes. Ingredients: 1 ounce of Bai Fuzhi (processed), Ban Xia, Chuan Qiong, Gan Ju Hua, Nan Xing (processed), 1 ounce of Bai Jiang Can (fried), Chen Pi (white part removed), Xuan Fu Hua, Tian Ma, each 1 ounce, and 0.5 ounce of fried whole scorpion. Grind to powder, soak in ginger juice, steam into dough balls the size of a walnut, taken with ginger soup, 30 pills.

Ding Feng Cake: Treats phlegm and wind, headache, vomiting, and dizziness.

Ingredients: Chuan Wu, Chuan Qiong, Nan Xing, Ban Xia, Bai Fu Ling, Bai Fuzhi, Gan Jiang, Tian Ma, and raw Licorice, all in equal parts. Grind to powder, mix with ginger juice to form pills the size of Qian Shi (fox nuts), flatten to make cakes, coat with cinnabar, and chew each cake thoroughly, taken with ginger soup.[184p]

　　加味调中益气汤 【东垣，下同】 　治气血俱虚头痛，其效如神。　　黄芪蜜炒一钱　人参　苍朮　甘草炙各七分　陈皮　当归身　川芎各五分　木香　蔓荆子　细辛　柴胡　升麻各三分右銼，作一贴，水煎服。
　　安神汤　治气血虚而有火，头痛头旋眼黑。　　黄芪一钱半　羌活　黄蘗酒浸，各一钱　柴胡　升麻　生地黄酒浸　知母酒浸，各五分　防风二分半　生甘草　炙甘草各二分　右，兑水煎数沸，入川芎、蔓荆子各三分，再煎至半，食后温服。东垣、丹溪治虚热头痛，大率皆以酒芩、酒连、酒蘗加风剂也。
　　羌活附子汤　治大寒犯脑，令人脑痛齿亦痛，名曰脑风。　　麻黄　附子　防风　白芷　白僵蚕炒，各一钱　黄蘗炒　羌活　苍朮各七分　黄芪炙　升麻　甘草炙，各五分　右銼，作一贴，食后水煎服。若有寒嗽，加佛耳草三分。[185p]

Jiawei Tiaozhong Yiqi Decoction treats both Qi and blood deficiency headaches, and its efficacy is remarkable. Ingredients include: honey-fried Astragalus (1 qian), Ginseng, Atractylodes, and roasted Licorice (each 7 fen), dried Tangerine Peel, Angelica, and Chuanxiong (each 5 fen), as well as Costus, Vitex, Asarum, Bupleurum, and Cimicifuga (each 3 fen). Grind these into a fine powder, make a dose, and decoct in water for consumption.

Anshen Decoction treats Qi and blood deficiency accompanied by heat, with symptoms of headache, dizziness, and dim vision. Ingredients include: Astragalus (1.5 qian), Qianghuo, and Huangqin (each 1 qian, wine-soaked), Bupleurum, Cimicifuga, Shengdihuang (wine-soaked), and Zhimu (wine-soaked, each 5 fen), as well as Fangfeng (2.5 fen), and both raw Licorice and roasted Licorice (each 2 fen). Combine these, decoct in water for several boils, then add Chuanxiong and Vitex (each 3 fen), and further decoct until reduced by half; consume warm after meals. Dongyuan and Danxi treat virtual heat headaches, generally with additions of wine-processed Qingshi, Lianhua, and Banzhilian with wind agents.

Qianghuo Fuzheng Decoction treats severe cold invading the brain, causing headache and tooth pain, known as "brain wind." Ingredients include: Ephedra, Fuzheng, Fangfeng, Bai Zhi, and roasted silkworm (each 1 qian), wine-fried Huangqin, Qianghuo, and Atractylodes (each 7 fen), and roasted Astragalus, Cimicifuga, and roasted Licorice (each 5 fen). Grind these into a fine powder, make a dose, and consume after meals decocted in water. If there is a cold cough, add 3 fen of Fuyuancao.[185p]

　　清空膏　即古方追涎药，治风湿热偏正头痛。　　黄芩三两，半生、半酒炒　甘草炙一两半　防风　羌活　黄连酒炒，各一两　柴胡七钱　川芎五钱　右为末，每二钱茶清调成膏，临卧抹口内，少用白汤送下。此膏治诸般头痛皆效；惟血虚头痛，从鱼尾相连痛者不治。
　　小清空膏 【丹溪，下同】 　治证同上。　　片芩细切，酒拌晒干　右为末，茶清调下二钱，酒亦可。
　　不卧散　治头痛不可忍。
　　延胡索七枚　青黛二钱　猪牙皂角二两　右为末，用水调成小饼子，如杏仁大；令病人仰卧，以水化开，以竹管送入男左女右鼻孔中，觉药味至喉少酸，令病人坐，口咬铜钱一个，涎出盈盆，即愈。
　　如圣饼子　治风寒伏留阳经，气厥痰厥，一切头痛。　　天南星　干姜　川芎　川乌　生甘草各一两　半夏制　天麻　细辛　防风各五钱　右为末，姜汁面糊和丸芡实大，捏作饼子，每五饼细嚼，茶清、温酒任下。[186p]

Qingkong Gao - This is an ancient remedy for chasing away phlegm and is used to treat wind, dampness, and hot, localized headaches.

Ingredients:

  • 3 taels of Huangqin (Scutellaria baicalensis), stir-fried half in water, half in wine
  • 1.5 taels of Zhi Gancao (honey-fried licorice)
  • 1 tael each of Fangfeng (Saposhnikovia divaricata), Qianghuo (Notopterygium incisum), and Huanglian (Coptis chinensis) stir-fried in wine
  • 7 qian of Chaihu (Bupleurum chinense)
  • 5 qian of Chuanxiong (Rhizoma Chuanxiong)

Grind these ingredients into a powder. For each 2 qian, mix with tea to form a paste, to be applied inside the mouth before sleeping and swallowed with a small amount of clear water. This paste is effective for various types of headaches; however, it does not treat headaches arising from blood deficiency that are connected to the outer corners of the eyes.

Xiao Qingkong Gao - Similar to the above remedy.

Preparation: Slice the Huangqin finely, mix with wine, and dry. Grind into powder. Take 2 qian mixed with tea or wine to ingest.

Bu Wo San - For unbearable headaches.

Ingredients:

  • 7 pieces of Yan Husuo (Corydalis yanhusuo)
  • 2 qian of Qingdai (Indigo naturalis)
  • 2 taels of Zhuyazaojiao (soapberry)

Grind these into powder and form small cakes the size of almonds. The patient should lie on their back and dissolve the cake in water, then use a bamboo tube to administer it to the left nostril for males and the right for females. When they taste a slight sourness in the throat, have them sit up and bite on a copper coin to stimulate saliva, which should fill a basin, indicating recovery.

Ru Sheng Bingzi - For wind-cold settling in the Yang channel, qi disturbances, phlegm blockage, and all types of headaches.

Ingredients:

  • 1 tael each of Tiannanxing (Arisaema), Ganjiang (dried ginger), Chuanxiong, and Chuanwu (Aconitum)
  • 1 tael of Sheng Gancao (raw licorice)
  • 5 qian each of Banxia (Pinellia)
  • Tianma (Gastrodia elata)
  • Xixin (Asarum)
  • Fangfeng

Grind these into powder, mix with ginger juice to form a paste the size of millet, and roll into cakes. Chew 5 cakes thoroughly, and they may be taken with hot tea or warm wine at will.[186p]

　　三生丸 【《得效方》，下同】 　治痰厥头痛。　　半夏　白附子　天南星各等分　右为末，姜汁浸，蒸饼和丸菉豆大，食后，姜汤下四五十丸。
　　防风散　治积热上冲头痛如火。

San Sheng Wan [From "De Xiao Fang," same below]
Treats phlegm-induced headaches.
Equal parts of Ban Xia, Bai Fu Zi, and Tian Nan Xing, grind into powder, soak in ginger juice, steam into pellets the size of mung beans. After eating, take 40 to 50 pellets with ginger soup.

Fang Feng San
Treats headache from excessive heat rising.
Equal parts of Qiang Huo, Fang Feng, Dang Gui, Sheng Da Huang, Chuan Xiong, Shan Zhi Zi, and Bo He, each 1 qian; Chen Ke and Gan Cao, each 5 fen. Grind together to make a plaster, add 20 strands of lamp wick and 10 pieces of bitter bamboo leaves, decoct in water and take.

Tai Yang Dan
For cold in the head caused by external evil attacking the upper jiao, leading to persistent headaches, day and night. This medicine addresses it.
2 qian of Long Nao, 2 liang of Shi Gao, 1 liang each of Chuan Xiong, Chuan Wu (prepared), Bai Zhi, and Gan Cao. Grind together, mix with honey and flour paste, form pellets (18 per liang), coat with Huang Dan. Take 2 to 3 pellets after meals, chewing them down with green onion tea.

Xiong Wu San [From "Ru Men," same below]
Treats headaches.
Equal parts of Chuan Xiong and Wu Yao, grind into powder, take 2 qian mixed with burning scales hammered and dissolved in wine. Also treats postpartum headaches.
Another formula treats dizziness and severe headaches caused by cold and dampness.[187p]

　　川芎二钱　白朮炒　附子生各一钱　甘草生　橘皮各五分　右銼，作一贴，入姜七片，枣二枚，水煎服。
　　一粒金(口畜)鼻法　治风涎偏正头痛。　　荜拨末三钱，入猪胆内，拌匀候干　川芎　白芷　槁本　青黛　延胡索各二钱　右为末，水和为丸，如芡实大，令病人卧，用一丸水化灌入鼻中，觉药味至喉少酸，令病人坐，口咬铜钱一　，当涎出盈盆即愈。
　　当归补血汤 【《医鉴》】 　治血虚头痛。　　生干地黄酒炒　白芍药　川芎　当归　片芩酒炒，各一钱　防风　柴胡　蔓荆各五分　荆芥　槁本各四分　右銼，作一贴，水煎服。
　　七生丸 【《回春》，下同】 　治男女八般头风，及一切头痛，痰厥肾厥，伤寒伤风头痛并治。　　川芎　川乌　草乌　南星　半夏二味，洗去滑　白芷　石膏俱生用，等分　加细辛　全蝎各减半　右为细末，研取韭菜自然汁，和丸梧子大，嚼生葱，茶清送下七丸或九丸。[188p]

Chuanxiong: 2 qian
Bai Zhu (fried): 1 qian
Fu Zi (fresh): 1 qian
Gan Cao (fresh): 5 fen
Ju Pi: 5 fen
Grind the above ingredients, make into a paste, and add 7 slices of ginger and 2 jujubes, then boil with water and take the decoction.

A single grain of gold in the nostrils treats wind phlegm-related headaches. Combine 3 qian of powdered Bi Bo in a pig's gallbladder, mix well, and dry.
Then take 2 qian each of Chuanxiong, Bai Zhi, Gao Ben, Qing Dai, and Yan Hu Suo, making these into a powder. Mix with water to form pills the size of foxnuts. Have the patient lie down and administer one pill dissolved in water into the nostril until they feel the medicinal taste reach the throat with a slight sourness. Have the patient sit up and hold a copper coin in their mouth; once the phlegm fills the basin, they will recover.

Dang Gui Bu Xue Tang (from "Yi Jian"): Treats blood deficiency headaches.
Ingredients: fresh Di Huang (stir-fried with wine), Bai Shao, Chuanxiong, Dang Gui, and Ban Xia (stir-fried with wine) each 1 qian; Fang Feng, Chai Hu, and Man Jing each 5 fen; Jing Jie and Gao Ben each 4 fen. Grind the above, make into a paste, and take as a decoction.

Qi Sheng Wan (from "Hui Chun", same below): Treats various headaches in men and women, as well as all types of headaches, phlegm and kidney-related issues, and those caused by cold and flu.
Ingredients: Chuanxiong, Chuan Wu, Cao Wu, Nan Xing, and Ban Xia (two types, washed and cleaned), Bai Zhi, Shi Gao (all fresh and used in equal parts). Add Xi Xin and Quan Xie (both halved). Grind all into fine powder, extract the natural juice from Leeks, and mix to form pills the size of wutong seeds. Chew with raw scallions and wash down with clear tea, taking 7 or 9 pills.[188p]

　　黄芪益气汤　治气虚头痛。
　　黄芪蜜炒，一钱　人参　白朮　半夏制　陈皮各七分　当归酒洗　川芎　槁本　甘草各五分　黄蘗酒炒　升麻　细辛各三分　右銼，作一贴，入姜三片，枣二枚，水煎服。
　　加味四物汤　治血虚阴火，上冲头痛。　　当归　川芎　生干地黄　黄蘗　知母　黄芩　黄连以上五味，俱酒炒　蔓荆子　栀子炒，各七分　右銼，作一贴，水煎服。
　　六圣散　诸头痛总治之要药也。治头风牙痛赤眼，脑泻、耳鸣，偏正头风头疼，鼻塞声重。　　乳香　没药　川芎　雄黄　白芷各二钱　芒硝五钱　右为末，令病人仰卧，口含凉水，取药少许，(口畜)入鼻内，即效。
　　四神散 【《良方》，下同】 　治妇人血风眩运头痛。　　甘菊　当归　旋覆花　荆芥穗各等分　右为末，每二钱，葱白三寸，茶末一钱，煎水调下。[189p]

Huangqi Yiqi Decoction treats headaches due to qi deficiency.

Preparation: Honey-fried Huangqi (Astragalus), 1 qian; Ginseng, Baizhu, Banxia(cooked), Chenpi (dried tangerine peel) each 7 fen; Danggui (Angelica), washed with wine; Chuanxiong (loganic) and dried branches, Gan Cao (licorice) each 5 fen; Huangbo (Phellodendron) fried with wine; Shengma (cimicifuga) and Xixin (asarum) each 3 fen. Grind these into powder, make into a packet, add 3 slices of ginger, 2 jujubes, and decoct with water for consumption.

Jiawei Siwu Decoction treats headaches due to blood deficiency and upward heat.

Preparation: Danggui, Chuanxiong, Sheng Gan Di Huang (raw Chinese foxglove), Huangbo, Zhimu (anemarrhena) and Huangqin (scutellaria) each 7 fen, all stir-fried with wine; Manjingzi (vitex) and Zhi Zhi (gardenia), each stir-fried, also 7 fen. Grind into powder, make into a packet, and decoct with water for consumption.

Liusheng San is a crucial remedy for all types of headaches. It treats head wind, toothache, red eyes, cerebral diarrhea, tinnitus, unilateral or bilateral headaches, nasal obstruction with a heavy voice.

Preparation: Ruxiang (frankincense), Mo Yao (myrrh), Chuanxiong, Xionghuang (realgar), and Baizhi (angelica) each 2 qian; Mangxiao (bitter salt) 5 qian. Grind into powder, have the patient lie on their back, hold cool water in their mouth, take a small amount of the medicine and put it into the nose to see effect.

Sishen San treats women's blood wind vertigo and headaches.

Preparation: Gancao (licorice), Jujube, Xuansuhua (corydalis), and Jingjuesui (schizonepeta) in equal parts. Grind into powder, take 2 qian of the mixture, add 3 inches of green onion whites, and 1 qian of tea powder, decoct with water and consume.[189p]

　　芎辛导痰汤　治痰厥头痛。
　　半夏制，二钱　川芎　细辛　南星炮　陈皮　赤茯苓各一钱　枳壳麸炒　甘草各五分　右銼，作一贴，姜七片，水煎服。
　　芎藭酒 【《千金方》，下同】 　治脑风头重，颈项强，眼(目巟)(目巟)泪出，善欠，目欲眠睡，憎风；剧者，耳鸣，满眉眼疼，闷吐逆，眩倒不自禁；诸风乘虚经五脏六腑，皆为癫狂诸邪病，悉主之。　　芎藭　辛夷　天雄　人参　天门冬　柏子仁　磁石　石膏　茵芋　山茱萸　白头翁　桂心秦艽各三两　松萝　羚羊角　细辛　薯蓣　菖蒲　甘草各二两　云母一两，烧令赤，末为粉　防风四两　右二十一味，(口父)咀，以酒二斗渍七日。初服二合，渐加至五合，日三。有女人少时患风眩，发则倒地，为妇积年无儿，服此酒，并将紫石门冬丸服之，眩瘥，生儿平复。
　　人参汤　治头眩屋转眼不开。[190p]

Xiongxin PhlegXiongxin Decoction Treats phlegm dizziness and headaches.

Ban Xia (processed), 2 qian; Chuan Xiong, Xi Xin, Nan Xing (processed), Chen Pi, Chi Fu Ling, each 1 qian; Zhi Ke (stir-fried), Gan Cao, each 5 fen. Grind these together to make a paste. Add 7 slices of ginger, decoct in water, and take.

Xiongxin Wine [From "Qian Jin Fang", same below] Treats severe headache with neck stiffness, tearful eyes, propensity to yawn, desire to sleep, aversion to wind; in severe cases, tinnitus, pain around the eyes, nausea and vomiting, dizziness and collapse. Various wind conditions affecting the five organs and six bowels, leading to madness and other illnesses, are all treated.

Xiong Xin, Xin Yi, Tian Xiong, Ren Shen, Tian Men Dong, Bai Zi Ren, Ci Shi, Shi Gao, Yin Yu, Shan Zhu Yu, Bai Tou Weng, Gui Xin, Qin Jiao, each 3 liang; Song Luo, Ling Yang Jiao, Xi Xin, Shu Yu, Chang Pu, Gan Cao, each 2 liang; Yun Mu, 1 liang, burn until red and powder into fine flour. Fang Feng, 4 liang.

Combine these 21 ingredients, grind them, and soak in 2 dou of wine for seven days. Initially take 2 he, gradually increase to 5 he, three times a day. There was a woman who suffered from wind dizziness, falling to the ground when it occurred; after years of being childless, she took this wine along with Zi Shi Men Dong pill, recovered from dizziness and gave birth to a child.

Ren Shen Decoction Treats dizziness with inability to open the eyes.[190p]

　　人参　当归　防风　黄芪炙　麦门冬　芍药各二两　独活　白朮　桂心各三两　右九味，(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，分三服。
　　防风汤　治风眩呕逆，水浆不下，食辄呕，起即眩倒，发有时，手足厥冷。　　防风　防己　附子炮　干姜　甘草生各一两　桂心蜀椒各二两　右七味，(口父)咀，以水四升，煮取二升，分三服，日三。《古今录验》有白朮一两。　　又方　治头风眩欲倒，眼旋屋转，脑痛。　　防风　枳实　杏仁研　芎藭各三两　白茯神　前胡　生姜　半夏　麻黄各四两　细辛二两　竹沥三升　右十一味，(口父)咀，以水六升，合竹沥，煎取二升七合，分三服，频服三两剂佳。
　　茵芋汤　治风虚眩眼暗。
　　茵芋一两　人参　甘草　苁蓉　黄芪　茯苓　秦艽　厚朴　乌喙各二两　防风六两　山萸　松实各三两　右十二味，(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取二升半，分五服。强者一日夜尽；羸劣分五服，二日尽。[191p]

Ginseng, Angelica Sinensis, Wind Protecting Herb, roasted Astragalus, Ophiopogon, and Peony, each two taels; Duhuo, White Atractylodes, and Cinnamon, each three taels. These nine ingredients should be chewed and boiled with one dou of water to obtain three sheng; divide into three doses.

The Wind Protecting Decoction treats dizziness, vomiting, inability to drink, and vomiting upon eating. Symptoms include sudden dizziness, faintness, and coldness in the hands and feet. It consists of Wind Protecting Herb, Prepared Aconite, prepared Ligusticum, dried Ginger, and raw Licorice, each one tael; Cinnamon and Sichuan Pepper, each two taels. Chew these seven ingredients, boil with four sheng of water to obtain two sheng; divide into three doses, taken three times daily. There is also a formula in "Records of Ancient and Modern Verification" which includes one tael of White Atractylodes.

Another formula treats wind-related dizziness with a sensation of falling, eyes spinning, and headache. Ingredients include Wind Protecting Herb, Bitter Orange, Apricot Kernel (ground), and Chuanxiong, each three taels; White Poria, Radix Peucedani, fresh Ginger, Pinellia, and Ephedra, each four taels; and Asarum, two taels, and three sheng of bamboo juice. Chewed and boiled with six sheng of water, combine with bamboo juice, then simmer to obtain two sheng and seven jiao; divide into three doses and take frequently, three doses are preferable.

The Yi Yu Decoction treats wind deficiency with dizziness and dim vision. It consists of one tael of Yi Yu, Ginseng, Licorice, Cistanche, Astragalus, Poria, Qin Jiao, Magnolia Bark, and Gourds, each two taels; Wind Protecting Herb, three taels; and Mountain wolfberry fruit and Pine nuts, each three taels. Chew these twelve ingredients, boil with one dou of water to obtain two and a half sheng; divide into five doses. Strong patients may take it all in one day; those weaker should divide into five doses over two days.[191p]

　　鸱头酒　治风头眩转，面上游风。
　　飞鸱头五枚　独活二两　茯神　防风　芎藭　薯蓣各四两　葛根　桂心辽细辛　人参　天雄炮　干姜　枳实　贯众　蜀椒各三两　山茱萸一升　麦门冬　石楠各五两　右十八味，(口父)咀，绢囊盛清酒四斗，渍六宿，初服二合，日再服，稍加，以知为度。一本无茯神、麦门冬、石楠，有天门冬、石膏。
　　大三五七散　治头风眩运，口喎，目斜，耳聋。　　天雄炮　细辛各三两　山茱萸　干姜各五两　薯蓣　防风各七两　右六味，治下筛酒，服五分匕，日再，不知稍加。

Chī Tóu Jiǔ (Owl Head Wine) treats wind-induced dizziness and floating sensations on the face.

Ingredients:

  • 5 pieces of flying owl heads
  • 2 taels of Du Huo
  • 4 taels each of Fu Shen, Fang Feng, Xiong Fu, and Shu Yu
  • 3 taels each of Ge Gen, Gui Xin, Liao Xi Xin, Ren Shen, Tian Xiong Pao, Gan Jiang, Zhi Shi, Guanzhong, and Shu Jiao
  • 1 sheng of Shan Zhu Yu
  • 5 taels each of Mai Men Dong and Shi Nan

Mix these 18 ingredients, grind them, and store them in a silk bag. Soak in 4 dou of clear wine for 6 nights. Initially, take 2 he, twice a day, gradually increasing as determined by one's tolerance. One version omits Fu Shen, Mai Men Dong, and Shi Nan, and includes Tian Men Dong and Shi Gao instead.

Dà Sān Wǔ Qī Sǎn (Large Three Five Seven Powder) treats headaches, dizziness, slanting vision, and deafness.

Ingredients:

  • 3 taels of Tian Xiong Pao
  • 3 taels of Xi Xin
  • 5 taels each of Shan Zhu Yu and Gan Jiang
  • 7 taels each of Shu Yu and Fang Feng

Mix these 6 ingredients, strain in wine, and take 5 fen, twice daily, gradually increasing as needed.

Xiǎo Sān Wǔ Qī Sǎn (Small Three Five Seven Powder) treats headaches, visual disturbances, and deafness.

Ingredients:

  • 3 taels of Tian Xiong Pao
  • 7 taels of Shu Yu
  • 5 taels of Shan Zhu Yu

Mix these 3 ingredients, strain in clear wine, and take 5 fen, twice daily. Gradually increase as needed, guided by one's tolerance.[192p]

　　茯神汤　治风眩倒屋转，吐逆，恶闻人声。　　生姜三两　茯神　独活各四两　远志　防风　黄芪制，各五两　甘草炙　人参　当归　牡蛎　白朮　苁蓉　附子各二两　右十三味，(口父)咀，以劳水一斗二升，煮取三升，服五合，一日夜尽。
　　防风散　治头面风在眉间，得热如虫行，或头眩运，目中泪出。　　防风五两　桂心天雄　细辛　朱砂　干姜　人参　乌头炮　附子炮，各二两　莽草　茯苓　当归各一两　右十二味，治下筛酒，服方寸匕，日三。　　又方　治风头眩，恶风，吐冷水，心闷。　　防风二两　泽泻　天雄　细辛　附子　薯蓣　茯苓各一两　白朮土炒，二两半　桂心一两半　干姜半两　右十味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕。常令酒气相接，则脱巾帽，解发，梳头百过，后投一升酒，便洗手足，须臾自热，解发以粉粉之，快然便熟眠，愈。亦可洗头面汗出。一本有泽兰，无泽泻。　　又方　治风眩翻倒无定。[193p]

Fuling Decoction: Used to treat dizziness from wind, loss of balance, vomiting, and aversion to the sound of voices.

Ingredients:

  • Fresh Ginger: 6 oz.
  • Fuling (Poria): 4 oz.
  • Duhuo (Angelica): 4 oz.
  • Yuanzhi (Polygala): 5 oz.
  • Fangfeng (Siler): 5 oz.
  • Huangqi (Astragalus): 5 oz.
  • Licorice (decooked): 2 oz.
  • Ginseng: 2 oz.
  • Angelica: 2 oz.
  • Oyster Shell: 2 oz.
  • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes): 2 oz.
  • Cistanche: 2 oz.
  • Fuzi (Aconite): 2 oz.

The above thirteen ingredients are crushed, then boiled in 12 liters of water, reducing to 3 liters. Take 5 ounces, completed within a night.

Fangfeng Powder: Treats wind affecting the head and face, causing sensations like insects crawling, dizziness, and tears in the eyes.

Ingredients:

  • Fangfeng: 5 oz.
  • Cinnamon Twig: 2 oz.
  • Xixin (Asarum): 2 oz.
  • Cinnabar: 2 oz.
  • Dried Ginger: 2 oz.
  • Ginseng: 2 oz.
  • Processed Aconite: 2 oz.
  • Processed Fuzi: 2 oz.
  • Mangcao: 1 oz.
  • Fuling (Poria): 1 oz.
  • Angelica: 1 oz.

The above twelve ingredients are mixed, treated with rice wine, and taken with a small spoon three times a day.

Another Recipe: For dizziness from wind, aversion to wind, vomiting cold water, and chest tightness.

Ingredients:

  • Fangfeng: 2 oz.
  • Zexie (Alisma): 1 oz.
  • Cinnamon Twig: 1 oz.
  • Xixin (Asarum): 1 oz.
  • Fuzi: 1 oz.
  • Dioscorea: 1 oz.
  • Fuling (Poria): 1 oz.
  • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes) roasted: 2.5 oz.
  • Cinnamon: 1.5 oz.
  • Dried Ginger: 0.5 oz.

The above ten ingredients are mixed, treated with rice wine, and taken with a small spoon. When using wine, remove hats and bind the hair, combing it a hundred times. Afterward, pour in a liter of wine to wash hands and feet; warmth will arise, and the hair can be powdered for quick sleep and recovery. It may also be used to wash away sweat from the head and face. One version includes Zexian but not Zexie.

Another Recipe: For wind-induced dizziness and instability.[193p]

　　独活六两　石膏　蒴藋各四两　枳实三两　右四味(口父)咀，以清酒八升，煮取四升，顿服之；以药滓熨头，复眠取汗，觉冷，又内铛中炒令热熨之。一本有楮实，无枳实。　　又方　治患头眩运，经久得瘥后，四体渐羸，食无味，好食黄土。　　曲二斤　白朮三斤　右二味为末，酒和，并手丸如梧桐子大，曝干，饮服三十丸，日三。断食土为效。　　又方　治头中五十种病。[194p]

To treat ailments: Use six taels of du huo, four taels each of gypsum and bai jiao, and three taels of zhi shi. Crush these four ingredients, boil them in eight sheng of clear wine, and when reduced to four sheng, take it all at once. Use the residue to apply a hot compress on the head and then rest to induce sweating. If feeling cold, reheat the compress in a pot. One version of this formula includes chu shi instead of zhi shi.

Additionally, to treat symptoms of dizziness and lingering ill effects over time, with gradual weakening of the body and lack of taste in food, and an inclination to eat yellow earth: grind two jin of qu and three jin of bai zhu into a powder. Mix with wine, form into pills the size of a wutong seed, and dry them out. Take thirty pills, three times a day, while abstaining from eating earth for better effect.

Furthermore, there is another formula to treat fifty kinds of ailments in the head.[194p]

　　巴戟天　白菊花　芎藭　干姜　防风　石楠　白朮　乌头炮　附子炮　细辛　薯蓣　蜀椒　人参　桔梗　秦艽　泽泻　甘草生　天雄炮　栝蒌根　山茱萸　干地黄　羌活各等分　右二十二味，治下筛，以酒服方寸匕，日三。
　　摩头散　治同前。
　　(艹闾)茹　半夏　蜀椒各六分　乌头炮八分　桂心七分　莽草四分　附子炮　细辛各一两　右八味，治下筛，以大酢和摩头记日数。三日头肤痛，四五日后一着药如前，十日以酢浆洗头，复摩药即愈。若生息肉，并喉咽中息肉，大如枣，欲塞，以药摩之即愈。耳鼻齿有疾，并用之良。
　　入顶散　治头面胀满，脑瘈偏枯，发作有时，状似刀刺，失声阴阴然疼，面目变青。　　山茱萸　芎藭　防风　独活各一两半　细辛　莽草　自朮　薯蓣　牛膝　石楠　甘草生各一两　乌头炮　通草　菖蒲　附子炮　麻黄　天雄炮　蜀椒　桔梗各一两六钱　右十九味，治下筛酒服方寸匕，日三。[195p]

Bahijian, white chrysanthemum, notopterygium, dried ginger, saposhnikovia, stone flowering, white atractylodes, fuzi (prepared aconite), xixin, dioscorea, Sichuan pepper, ginseng, balloon flower, gentian, alisma, licorice root, tianxiong (prepared aconite), polygala root, corni fruit, prepared rehmannia, and qinghao, equal parts. The twenty-two ingredients above are to be filtered and taken with a small spoonful of wine, three times a day.

Motou powder is for the same treatment.

The herbs (caolu) are: half summer, Sichuan pepper, six parts; fuzi (prepared aconite) eight parts; cinnamon heart seven parts; raw herb four parts; fuzi (prepared aconite) and xixin, each one tael. These eight ingredients are to be filtered, mixed with vinegar, and used to massage the scalp according to the number of days. For scalp pain lasting three days, after four or five days, take the medicine as before, and on the tenth day, wash the head with vinegar and paste. For growths in the throat and pharynx, the size of jujubes, use the medicine for massage to achieve recovery. This is also effective for diseases of the ears, nose, and teeth.

Rudeng powder is for treating swelling and fullness in the head and face, with splenetic brain, intermittent pain resembling stabbing, loss of voice, and facial discoloration. Ingredients include: corni fruit, notopterygium, saposhnikovia, and dry chrysanthemum, each one and a half taels; xixin, raw herb, dioscorea, niuxi, stone flowering, and licorice root, each one tael; fuzi (prepared aconite), tongcao, calamus, and tianxiong (prepared aconite), Sichuan pepper, and balloon flower, each one tael and six qian. These nineteen ingredients are to be filtered and taken in a spoonful of wine, three times a day.[195p]

　　杏仁膏　治上气头面风头痛，胁中气满，贲(犭屯)，气上下往来，心下烦热，产妇金疮诸病。　　杏仁二升，去皮尖，双仁者不用　右一味捣研，以水一斗滤取汁令尽，以铜器盛置煻火上，从旦煮至日入，当熟如脂膏，下之。空腹，酒服一方寸匕，日三。不饮酒者，以米饮服之。慎猪鱼蒜酢。
　　大豆酒　治头风。
　　大豆二升，炒令无声　右一味，先以一斗二升，瓶盛清酒九升，乘豆热，即倾着酒中，密泥头，七日，温服之。　　又方　治中风头痛发热，耳颊急。
　　麻黄　葛根　石膏　桂心各三两　附子炮　芍药　甘草　秦艽　防风各二两　生姜五两　右十味，(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，分三服，温覆取汗。[196p]

Almond Paste: Treats upper respiratory issues, headaches, fullness in the sides, and issues with the heart such as heat and anxiety, as well as postpartum wounds and various ailments. Use two sheng of almonds, removing the skin and tips, do not use double kernels. Grind the above ingredients with one dou of water and filter to extract the juice completely. Place it in a copper vessel over the fire and boil from dawn until sunset until it becomes like a fatty paste, then cool. Take on an empty stomach, mixing one tablespoon with wine three times daily. For those who do not drink alcohol, use rice-based drink instead. Avoid pork, fish, garlic, and vinegar.

Soybean Wine: Treats headaches. Use two sheng of soybeans, toast until silent. Combine this with one dou and two sheng of clean wine, and nine sheng of wine when the soybeans are hot; pour the wine over and seal tightly with mud. After seven days, take it warm.

Another formula: Treats wind, headaches, fever, and acute ear or cheek pain.

Ingredients: Three taels each of Ephedra, Kudzu Root, Gypsum, and Cinnamon; two taels each of Prepared Aconite, Peony, Licorice, Gentian, and Fangfeng; five taels of fresh ginger. Grind these ten ingredients, add one dou of water, and boil down to three sheng. Divide into three doses and take warm to induce sweating.[196p]

　　薯蓣散　治头目有风，牵引目睛疼痛，偏视不明。　　薯蓣三两　细辛一两半　秦艽　天雄各二两　独活　桂心山茱萸各二两半　右七味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕，日三。　　又方　治头中痛，身热风热。
　　竹沥三升　升麻　生姜　杏仁各三两　芍药　柴胡各四两　石膏　生葛根各八两　右八味，(口父)咀，以水六升，合竹沥煮取二升七合，分三服。
　　菊花散　治头面游风。
　　菊花一两　细辛　附子　桂心干姜　巴戟　人参　石楠　天雄　茯苓　秦艽　山茱萸　防己　防风　白朮　薯蓣各三两　蜀椒五合　右十七味，治下筛酒，服方寸匕，日三。　　又方　治头面上风。
　　松脂　石盐　杏仁　蜜蜡为末，各一两　熏陆香二两　蓖麻仁三两　右六味，熟捣作饼，净剃百会上发，贴药饼，上安纸，三日一易，若痒刺。药上不久，风定。[197p]

Yam Powder: Treats headaches caused by wind, pulling pain in the eyes, and unclear vision.

Ingredients: 3 liang of yam, 1.5 liang of asarum, 2 liang each of gentian and tian xiong, 2.5 liang each of angelica and cinnamon, 2.5 liang of evodia.

Preparation: Grind the seven ingredients, take with wine, using a tongue-depressor-sized spoon, three times a day.

Another formula: Treats headache and body heat due to wind.

Ingredients: 3 sheng of bamboo juice, 3 liang each of hemp root, ginger, and apricot kernel, 4 liang each of peony and bupleurum, 8 liang each of gypsum and raw kudzu.

Preparation: Chew the eight ingredients, use 6 sheng of water, combine with bamboo juice, boil to obtain 2.7 sheng, and divide into three doses.

Chrysanthemum Powder: Treats wind affecting the head and face.

Ingredients: 1 liang of chrysanthemum, 3 liang each of asarum, aconite, cinnamon, ba jiao, ginseng, stones of the heather, tian xiong, poria, gentian, evodia, kava, and windbreak, 3 liang each of white atractylodes and yam, 5 he of pepper.

Preparation: Grind into powder, take with wine, using a tongue-depressor-sized spoon, three times a day.

Another formula: Treats wind affecting the upper head and face.

Ingredients: 1 liang each of pine resin, rock salt, apricot kernel, and beeswax ground into powder; 2 liang of frankincense; 3 liang of castor beans.

Preparation: Mix the six ingredients into a dough, apply to the shaved scalp, cover with paper, change every three days if it itches. The medicine will act quickly, stabilizing the wind.[197p]

　　头风散　治头风。
　　附子一枚，中形者　盐如附子大　右二味，治下筛，沐头竟，以方寸匕摩顶上，日三。
　　沐头汤　治肺劳热，不问冬夏老少，头生白屑，搔痒不堪。然肺为五脏之盖，其劳损伤肺，气冲头顶，致使头痒多生白屑，搔之随手起，人多患此，皆从肺来，世呼为头风也。　　大麻子　秦椒各三升　皂荚屑五合　右三味熟研，内泔中，渍一宿，去滓，以木匕搅百遍，取劳，乃用沐头，发际更别作皂荚汤濯之，然后敷膏。　　又方　治证同上。
　　甘菊花　独活　茵芋　防风　细辛　蜀椒　皂荚　杜蘅　莽草　桂心右十味，各等分，可作汤沐及熨之。　　又方　治证同上。
　　猪椒根三两　麻黄根　防风各二两　细辛　茵芋各一两　右五味(口父)咀，以水三斗，煮取一斗，去滓，温以沐头。[198p]

Head Wind Powder: To treat head wind.

Ingredients: One piece of Aconite, medium in size; salt equal to Aconite in size. Combine these two ingredients. Treat with a sieve and rinse the head, then use a thumb-sized spatula to rub the top of the head, three times daily.

Head Washing Decoction: Treats lung heat conditions. Regardless of winter or summer, young or old, if there is white flaking on the scalp and unbearable itching. The lungs are the cover of the five organs; if the lungs are damaged, it can lead to qi rising to the head, causing itching and the formation of white flakes. This is commonly termed "head wind" in society.

Ingredients: Three sheng each of Hemp Seed and Sichuan Pepper; five he of Soap Pod flakes. Grind these three ingredients thoroughly, place them in strained rice water, soak overnight, removing the residue. Stir thoroughly with a wooden spatula (hundred times), and then use it to wash the head, additionally rinsing the hairline with Soap Pod decoction before applying the ointment.

Another Recipe: For the same symptoms as above.

Ingredients: Ten ingredients including Sweet Chrysanthemum, Angelica, Gentian, Saposhnikovia, Asarum, Sichuan Pepper, Soap Pod, Du Huang, Wild Grass, and Cinnamon. Each in equal parts can be made into a decoction for washing or applying poultices.

Another Recipe: For the same symptoms as above.

Ingredients: Three taels of Pig Pepper root; two taels each of Ephedra and Saposhnikovia; one tael each of Asarum and Gentian. Grind these five ingredients, boil with three dou of water to reduce to one dou, strain, and warm it for washing the head.[198p]

　　犀角汤　治风毒热头面肿。
　　犀角屑　生姜各二两　苦参　栝蒌根　防风各一两　石膏六两　竹叶二握　黄芩　青木香　升麻各三两　防已一两半右十一味，(口父)咀，以水七升，煮取二升，分三服，相去十里久，内消不利。
　　防风散　治头面遍身风肿。
　　防风一两　白朮三两　白芷一两　右三味，治下筛，酒服方寸匕，日三。
　　续命汤　治风眩，发则烦闷无知，口沫出，四体角弓，目反上，口噤不得言。　　竹沥一升五合　生地黄汁一升　生姜　防风　麻黄各四两　龙齿煅，四两　防己三两　附子炮，三分　石膏十两　桂心二两右十味，(口父)咀，以水一斗，煮取三升，分三服。有气加附子一两，紫苏子五合，橘皮半两。已服续命汤，口开，四肢尚未好定，而心中尚不除者，紫石汤主之。方见后，紫石煮散是也。[199p]

Rhinoceros Horn Decoction treats swelling of the head and face caused by wind and toxic heat.

Ingredients:

  • 2 taels of rhinoceros horn shavings
  • 2 taels of ginger
  • 1 tael each of sophora, gourd root, and fangfeng
  • 6 taels of gypsum
  • 2 handfuls of bamboo leaves
  • 3 taels each of yellow qin,青木香 (blue wood fragrance), and ascension bark
  • 1.5 taels of peucedanum

Prepare by grinding the above ingredients, adding 7 sheng of water, and boiling down to 2 sheng. Divide into three doses, taken ten miles apart, to alleviate internal obstruction.

Fangfeng Powder treats wind-induced swelling across head and body.

Ingredients:

  • 1 tael of fangfeng
  • 3 taels of white atractylodes
  • 1 tael of white angelica

Preparation: Use these three ingredients, sift through, and take with a small spoonful of wine three times a day.

Reviving Life Decoction treats wind dizziness, leading to confusion, excessive salivation, extreme stiffness in limbs, upward glare of the eyes, and inability to speak.

Ingredients:

  • 1.5 sheng of bamboo sap
  • 1 sheng of raw rehmannia juice
  • 4 taels each of ginger, fangfeng, and ephedra
  • 4 taels of calcined dragon teeth
  • 3 taels of peucedanum
  • 3 fen of prepared aconite
  • 10 taels of gypsum
  • 2 taels of cinnamon heart

Preparation: Grind the above, add 10 dou of water, and reduce to 3 sheng. Divide into three doses. If there is excess gas, add 1 tael of aconite, 5 he of perilla seeds, and 0.5 tael of dried tangerine peel. After taking the Reviving Life Decoction, if the mouth opens but the limbs have not fully recovered and there are still unresolved issues in the heart, the purpose is served by the Purple Stone Decoction mentioned later, which is made by boiling the purple stone powder.[199p]

　　小续命汤
　　防风一钱二分　桂枝　杏仁去皮尖，炒研　川芎酒洗　白芍酒炒　人参　甘草炙　麻黄　黄芩酒炒　防风各八分　附子四分右为末，每服三钱，加姜枣煎。
　　薯蓣汤　治心中惊悸而四肢缓，头面热，心胸痰满，头目眩冒，如欲摇动。　　薯蓣　麦门冬　人参各四两　生地黄　前胡　芍药各八分　枳实　远志去心　生姜各三分　茯苓　茯神各六分　半夏五分　甘草　竹叶各二分　黄芩二分　秫米三合　右十六味，(口父)咀。取江水，高举手扬三百九十下，量取三斗煮米，减一斗，内半夏，复减九升，去滓下药，煮取四升，分四服。无江水处，以千里东流水代之，搅手令上头也。秦中无江水，泾渭水可用，诸葛灌剑犹尚取之。[200p]

Xiao Xu Ming Decoction
Prepare: 1.2 grams of Siler, cinnamon twig, peeled and roasted almond tips, stir-fried and ground; wine-washed Ligusticum, white peony stir-fried in wine; ginseng; honey-fried licorice; ephedra; yellow quino wine-fried; Siler, each 0.8 grams; and 0.4 grams of aconite. Grind all into a fine powder. Each dose is 9 grams, boiled with ginger and jujube.

Yam Decoction
For treating heart palpitations and weakness in limbs, heat in head and face, phlegm fullness in the chest, dizziness, and a sensation of wanting to sway:
4 taels each of yam, ophiopogon, and ginseng;
0.8 taels each of raw rehmanni, bitter root, and peony;
0.3 taels each of bitter orange, prepared polygala (removing the heart), and fresh ginger;
0.6 taels each of poria and polysaccharide;
0.5 taels of pinellia;
0.2 taels each of licorice and bamboo leaf;
0.2 taels of yellow quino;
3 dou of proso millet.
Combine these sixteen ingredients (and finely chop). Take river water, raise your hand to stir it 390 times, measure 3斗 for cooking the millet, reduce by 1斗, add pinellia, reduce again by 9 sheng, discard the residue, add the medicines, and boil down to 4 sheng, divided into four doses. If there is no river water, substitute with East River water; stir with hands to keep it on top. In Qin, if there is no river water, use Jingwei water instead; Zhuge used it as well.[200p]

　　防风汤　服前汤后，四体尚不凉冷，头目眩转者，服之。此汤大胜，宜长将服。但药中小小消息随冷暖耳。仍不除瘥者，依此方。　　防风　石膏　人参　赤石脂　生姜　寒水石　龙骨　茯苓各三分　桂心二分　紫石一分　右十味，(口父)咀，以水八升，煮取三升，分三服。凡用井华水者，取清净也。今用江水，无泥又无砂秽，源泉远涉，顺势归海，不逆上流，用以治头，必归于下也。[201p]

Fang Feng Decoction: If after taking this decoction, the body remains warm and the head feels dizzy, then use it. This decoction is highly effective and should be taken for a long time. However, the effects of the medicine may vary with heat and cold. If the condition does not improve, continue using this formula.

Ingredients: Fang Feng, Gypsum, Ginseng, Red Stone Fat, Ginger, Cold Water Stone, Dragon Bone, Poria, each three parts; Cinnamon Heart two parts; Purple Stone one part. These ten ingredients should be chewed and then boiled in eight liters of water to yield three liters, which should be divided into three doses. When using well water, it should be pure. Now, if using river water, ensure it is free of mud and sand, drawn from a distant source, flowing naturally to the sea and not against the current, as this will help treat the head and lead to a downward effect.[201p]

　　薯蓣圆　治头目眩冒，心中烦郁，惊悸狂癫。　　薯蓣二十八分　甘草二十分　大豆黄卷七分　鹿角胶　桂心各七分　干地黄　神曲　当归　人参各十分　麦门冬　防风　黄芩　芍药　白朮各六分　柴胡　桔梗　白茯苓　芎藭　杏仁各五分　白敛　干姜各三分　大枣一百枚，取膏　右二十二味为末，合白蜜枣膏，丸如弹丸，先食服一丸，日三。
　　天雄散　治头目眩运，屋转旋倒。
　　桂心三分　天雄　防风　芎藭　人参　独活　葛根各三分　莽草四分　白朮　远志　薯蓣　茯神　山茱萸各六分右十三味，治下筛，先食以菊花酒，服方寸匕，日二，渐加至三匕，以知为度。[202p]

Shuyu Yuan treats dizziness of the head, inner agitation, and symptoms of fright and madness.

Ingredients:

  • 28 parts of yam
  • 20 parts of licorice
  • 7 parts of yellow soybean paper
  • 7 parts of deer antler glue
  • 7 parts of cinnamon
  • 10 parts each of rehmannia, shenqu, angelica, and ginseng
  • 6 parts each of ophiopogon, fangfeng, huangqin, peony, and baizhu
  • 5 parts each of bupleurum, platycodon, white poria, chuanxiong, and apricot kernel
  • 3 parts each of white magnolia bark and dried ginger
  • 100 jujubes (remove the paste)

Combine these 22 ingredients into a powder, mix with white honey and jujube paste, and form into pills the size of a ball. Take one pill before meals, three times a day.

Tianxiong San treats dizziness and vertigo as if the room is turning upside down.

Ingredients:

  • 3 parts of cinnamon
  • 3 parts each of tianxiong, fangfeng, chuanxiong, ginseng, duhuo, and kudzu root
  • 4 parts of a herb (mangcao)
  • 6 parts each of baizhu, yuanzhi, yam, poria, and cornelian cherry

Take these 13 ingredients, sift them, and consume them before meals with chrysanthemum wine using a small spoon, starting with two doses a day, gradually increasing to three doses, determined by individual tolerance.[202p]

　　菊花酒　治头面病。
　　九月九日，取甘菊花晒干。右一味为末，以米饙中蒸作酒。
　　紫石煮散　治头眩运。大人风引，小儿惊癎瘈瘲，日数十发，医所不疗者。　　紫石英　滑石　白石脂　凝水石　赤石脂　石膏各六两　甘草　桂心牡蛎粉各五分　大黄　龙骨　干姜各四两右十二味，治下筛为粗散，盛以韦囊，悬于高凉处，欲用取三指撮，以新汲井水三升，煮取一升二合。大人顿服。未百日儿服一合；未能者，绵沾着口中。热多者，日四五服，以意消息。
　　升麻汤 【《局方》】 　治头痛。　　升麻　苍朮各一两　荷叶一个，全者　右为细末，每服五钱，水一盏，煎七分，温服。食后或烧全荷叶一个，研细调煎药服，亦妙。
　　白花蛇散 【《总录》，下同】 　治脑风疼痛，时作时止，及偏头风。　　白花蛇酒浸去皮骨，一两　石膏　荆芥各二两　天南星浆水煮软切炒，一两　地骨皮二钱半　右为末，每服一钱，茶下日三服。[203p]

Chrysanthemum Wine: Treats head and facial ailments.
On the ninth day of the ninth month, take sweet chrysanthemum flowers and dry them. Grind one part into a powder and steam it with rice to make wine.

Purple Stone Powder: Treats dizziness. For adults with wind-induced ailments, and for children with convulsions occurring dozens of times a day and untreatable by doctors.
Take six taels each of purple quartz, talc, white stone fat, condensed water stone, red stone fat, and gypsum; five parts each of licorice, cinnamon heart, and oyster shell powder; four taels each of rhubarb, dragon bone, and dried ginger. Mix these twelve ingredients, sift until coarse, store in a leather bag, and hang in a cool place. For use, take a pinch with three sheng of fresh spring water, boil down to one sheng and two jiao. Adults should take it at once. For children under a hundred days old, take one jiao; those unable to drink should have it dabbed on their mouths. For those with a lot of heat, take four to five doses a day as needed.

Shengma Decoction: Treats headaches.
One tael each of shengma and苍术, and one whole lotus leaf. Grind these into a fine powder. Take five qian with one cup of water and simmer to seven parts. Drink warm after meals. Alternatively, burn a whole lotus leaf, grind it finely, and mix it with the decoction; this method is also excellent.

White Flower Snake Powder: Treats wind-induced brain pain that comes and goes, as well as migraines.
One tael of white flower snake soaked and skinned, two taels each of gypsum and jinjiao; one tael of Tian Nansheng boiled soft, cut, and stir-fried; two and a half qian of earth bone skin. Grind these into a powder and take one qian with tea three times a day.[203p]

　　芎黄汤　治头目眩运。
　　大黄　荆芥穗　川芎　防风各等分　右为粗末，大作剂料，水煎去滓服之，以利为度。
　　香芎丸　治头痛。
　　香附子炒　川芎　石膏水飞　白芷　甘草　薄荷已上各一两　川乌半两，炒去皮脐　右为细末，每服二钱，温酒茶清调下，无时。
　　搜风丸　一名人参半夏丸，治头痛眩。　　蛤粉二两　人参　茯苓　藿香　薄荷　南星各半两　半夏　干姜　生矾　凝水石各一两　右为细末，与藏用丸末各中停，水丸如豌豆大，每服三十丸，生姜汤下。

　　独圣散 【《元戎》，下同】 　一名瓜蒂散。治头痛，服药针灸久不愈者，凡其湿气在上也。　　瓜蒂不拘多少　右为细末。每服一钱或二钱，虀汁调下服之。或用少许吹入鼻中，清水徐徐出一昼夜，湿尽痛止。一方加郁金少许。[204p]

Xiong Huang Decoction - Treats dizziness of the head.
Ingredients: Dahuang, Jingjiesui, Chuanxiong, Fangfeng, each in equal portions. Grind coarsely, prepare in large quantity, boil with water and take after straining, adjusting to ensure it is laxative.

Xiang Xiong Pill - Treats headaches.
Ingredients: Stir-fried Xiangfuzi, Chuanxiong, gypsum powder, Baizhi, licorice, and mint, each one tael; Chuanwu half a tael, stir-fried to remove the skin. Grind finely and take two qian, mixed with warm wine or tea, at any time.

Soufeng Pill - Also known as Ginseng Banxia Pill, treats headache and dizziness.
Ingredients: Two taels of crab powder, half a tael each of ginseng, Fuling, Huoxiang, mint; one tael each of Banxia, dried ginger, raw alum, and water stone. Grind finely, mix with the reserved pill powder, shape into pills the size of peas, taking thirty pills each time, washed down with ginger soup.

Cangyong Pill
Ingredients: Two taels of Dahuang and Huangqin; four taels of talcum powder and black morning glory. Grind into powder, shape into pills the size of tung seeds, taking fifty to seventy pills after meals with warm water.

Dusheng San - Also known as Guati San. Treats headaches, especially when acupuncture and medication have not cured it, particularly if dampness is present above.
Any amount of the gourd stem is ground finely. Each time, take one or two qian mixed with juice. Alternatively, use a small amount to blow into the nostrils, allowing clear water to gradually exit for a day and night; once the dampness is eliminated, pain subsides. One recipe adds a little Yujin.[204p]

　　大头病方　兼治喉痹。
　　人间治疫有仙方，一两僵蚕二大黄。姜汁为丸如弹大，井花调蜜便清凉。
　　大头时气方
　　马牙硝　寒水石　鼠粘子　鬼臼　川大黄　鬼箭草各等分　脑子少许　右七味为细末，用新井华水一盏，药末一二钱，入脑子。吃外一半，留用新水调稠鸡翎扫在肿处，在风凉处坐。
　　头运方 【丹溪，下同】 　治痰火眩运，清火利痰，极效。　　南星　半夏　甘草　桔梗　陈皮各一钱　枳壳七分　茯苓　黄芩各八分　右口　父咀，水二盏，姜七片，煎八分，食后服。
　　加味六君子汤　治气虚痰甚，风邪眩运不休者。　　人参　白朮　茯苓各一钱　陈皮　半夏各一钱五分　荆芥穗　甘草各五分　右水二盏，姜三片，枣二枚，煎一盏，去滓，入竹沥二匙，温服。[205p]

Great Head Disease Prescription - Also Treats Throat Paralysis.

In the mortal world, there are divine prescriptions for epidemics: one tael of dried silkworm and two taels of rhubarb. Use ginger juice to form into pills the size of a ball, mix with well water and honey for a refreshing effect.

Great Head Seasonal Prescription
Horse tooth ash, cold water stone, mouse sticky seed, ghost plant, Sichuan rhubarb, ghost arrow grass, all in equal parts; a small amount of brains. Grind these seven ingredients into a fine powder, use one cup of fresh well water, take one or two qian of the powdered herbs, and mix in the brains. Consume half externally, leaving the new water to thicken. Sweep on the swollen area with a chicken feather while sitting in a cool place.

Head Movement Prescription (Dan Xi, same applies) - Treats phlegm and fire causing dizziness, clears heat and promotes phlegm expulsion, extremely effective.
South star, half summer, licorice, balloon flower, dried tangerine peel, each one qian; fruit shell seven fen; poria and skullcap, each eight fen. Use water, two cups, seven slices of ginger, decoct to eight portions, take after meals.

Modified Six Gentlemen Decoction - Treats severe qi deficiency and phlegm, for those with dizziness from wind evil that does not cease.
Ginseng, white atractylodes, and poria, each one qian; dried tangerine peel and half summer, each one qian and five fen; schizopepet achenii and licorice, each five fen. Use two cups of water, three slices of ginger, two jujubes, decoct to one cup, strain, add two spoons of bamboo juice, and warm to consume.[205p]

　　补中益气汤　治烦劳内伤，身热心烦，头痛恶寒，懒言恶食，脉洪大而虚，或喘或渴，或阳虚自汗，或气虚不能摄血，或疟痢脾虚，久不能愈，一切清阳下陷中气不足之证。　　黄芪蜜炙，钱半　人参　甘草炙，各一钱　陈皮　白朮土炒　当归各五分　升麻　柴胡各三分　姜三片，枣二枚，煎。头痛加蔓荆子，痛甚加川芎，脑痛加槁本、细辛。

Buzhong Yiqi Decoction: Treats internal injury from fatigue, body heat and heart vexation, headache and aversion to cold, lack of speech and appetite, pulse is large yet weak, may also have wheezing or thirst, or sweating due to yang deficiency, or inability to retain blood from qi deficiency, or intermittent fever and diarrhea from spleen deficiency, unable to recover for a long time, and generally any signs of clear yang descending and insufficient central qi.
Ingredients: Honey-fried Astragalus (5 qian), Ginseng (1 qian), Honey-fried Licorice (1 qian), Aged Tangerine Peel (0.5 qian), Fried Atractylodes (0.5 qian), Angelica (0.5 qian), Scalsett (0.3 qian), Bupleurum (0.3 qian), three slices of ginger, two dates, decoct. For headache, add Vitex fruit; for severe pain, add Chuanxiong; for brain pain, add Ligusticum and Xixin.

Jinghuang Decoction: Treats wind-heat dizziness and malaise.
Ingredients: Fried Rhubarb (2 qian), Schizonepeta (2 qian), Fangfeng (2 qian); mix and decoct in water, adjust dosage for purgation.

Qianghuo Shengshi Decoction: Treats stiffness in the back, arms, and neck, feeling as if the waist is broken, neck pulling upwards leading to headache; indicative of obstruction in the foot-taiyang channel. This medicine is its main treatment.
Ingredients: Qianghuo (1 qian), DuHuo (1 qian), Ligusticum (1.5 qian), Fangfeng (1.5 qian), Chuanxiong (0.4 qian), Vitex fruit (0.4 qian), Honey-fried Licorice (0.4 qian); add two bowls of water, decoct to 80 ml, take warm after meals.[206p]

　　荆防败毒散　治大头天行时疫头痛，发散瘟邪。　　荆芥穗　防风　羌活　独活　前胡　枳壳炒　茯苓　薄荷　炙甘草　川芎　牛莠子　桔梗　人参各等分　水煎服。内热加黄连，渴加天花粉。

Jingfang Baidu San: Treats major head pain during epidemics, dispelling pestilential evils. Ingredients: equal parts of Jingjie, Fangfeng, Qianghuo, Duhuo, Qianhu, fried Zhike, Fuling, Bohe, roasted Gancao, Chuanxiong, Niuxi, Jiegeng, and Renchen. Decoction in water for oral administration. If there is internal heat, add Huanglian; if thirsty, add Tianhuafen.

Tongsheng Xiaodu San: Treats seasonal epidemics with swelling of the head and face, inability to open the eyes, nasal congestion, and dryness of the mouth and tongue, with internal and external heat. Symptoms may include sore throat causing difficulty, or constipation; restlessness with a rapid pulse: Fangfeng, Jingjie, Niubangzi, Gancao, Chuanxiong, Danggui, Baishao, Huangqin, Bohe, Zhizi, Jiegeng, talc, and Mahuang for those with aversion to cold, urgent symptoms without sweating, and a floating pulse. For those with hard stools, add Dahuang steeped in wine. Use for those with internal fullness and hard stool; do not use for those with internal deficiency and loose stool. Decock in water, warm and sip slowly.

Qingliang Jiuku San: Treats severe major head plague; when swelling is intense, apply this medicine externally. Ingredients: equal parts of Fujingye, Shuang Sangye, Bailian, Baiqi, Dahuang, Huanglian, Shancigu, Chixiaodou, Huangqin, Huangbai, Baizhi, Xionghuang, Mangxiao, Nanshen, and Jinxianzhonglou. Grind into a powder, mix with honey water, and apply to the swollen area, sweeping it frequently with a feather.[207p]

　　辛芎散　治热痰壅塞，头目不清，语音不出，服药不解，乃是热兼风痰所致，服此即愈。　　细辛　川芎　防风　桔梗　白朮土炒　羌活　桑白皮炒　薄荷叶各一两　甘草五分　右水二盏，姜三片，煎八分，食后温服。

　　都梁丸 【《百一选方》】 　治风吹项背，头目昏眩，及脑痛，妇人胎前产后伤风头痛。　　白芷大块，白者洗去土净，沸汤泡四五次，銼用　右銼，以萝卜汁浸，晒干为末，炼蜜丸如弹子大，每服一丸，细嚼，以茶清或荆芥汤下。[208p]

Xin Xiong San: Treats phlegm due to heat obstruction, causing a lack of clarity in the head and eyes, difficulty in speech, and persistence of symptoms despite taking medication, which is caused by a combination of heat and wind-phlegm. Taking this will lead to recovery. Ingredients: Xixin, Chuanxiong, Fangfeng, Jiegeng, Bai zhu (stir-fried), Qianghuo, Sangbai Pi (stir-fried), Bohe leaves (each one tael), Licorice (five fen). Prepare with two bowls of water, add three slices of ginger, simmer until reduced to one bowl, and take warm after meals.

Wen Zhong Hua Tan Wan: Treats stagnation of phlegm and residual fluids, causing chest distension, dizziness, nausea, coughing with phlegm, etc. Ingredients: Chenpi, Qingpi, Liangjiang, Ganjiang (each two taels). Grind these into fine powder, mix with vinegar to form small pills the size of a Chinese parasol seed, take thirty pills at a time with warm rice drink.

Ji Feng San: Treats male and female headaches caused by wind, including pains in the temples and head, restlessness when sitting or lying down. Ingredients: Raw Chuanwu (peeled) and cinnabar (each one tael), Nansheng (washed, two taels). Grind these into fine powder, mix with wine to apply to the painful areas; for children, apply to the fontanel.

Du Liang Wan (from "Bai Yi Xuan Fang"): Treats wind-induced pain in the neck and back, head dizziness, and headaches, especially in women before and after childbirth. Ingredients: Large pieces of Baizhi, wash the white ones to remove dirt, soak in boiling water four or five times, then grind. Use radish juice to soak, dry it into powder, and refine into pills the size of a marble. Take one pill, chew finely, and swallow with warm tea or a decoction of Jingjie.[208p]

Nine Dragon Pill - Treats various types of headaches for both women and men. Ingredients: Chuanxiong, Chuanwu, gypsum, Bai zhi, Cao wu, Nanjing star, Banxia (each at half two), Xixin, and Quanxie (each at two and a half qian). Grind these into powder, form into pills the size of a wutong seed. Take fifty pills with warm tea.

Tooth Soap Powder - Treats unilateral and bilateral headache pain. Ingredients: Zhuya soap beans (remove membranes), fragrant Bai zhi, and Bai fuzhi (equal portions). Grind into powder, take two qian after meals with warm tea. When pain is on the right side, lie on the right side; when pain is on the left, lie on the left side.

Flying Tiger Powder - Treats headache pain caused by wind-heat phlegm-fire. Ingredients: Bai fuzhi, Bai zhi, Jingjie, calcined gypsum, Chuanxiong, Tianma, mint, and Fangfeng (each at half two), and Cangzhu soaked in rice water (do not use if both ends are pointed and black-hearted, each at one qian). Grind into fine powder, take one qian after meals with warm wine or tea.

Heavenly Passage Powder - Treats unilateral and bilateral headaches with accompanying wind-heat obstruction. Ingredients: Chi Shaoyao, Chuanxiong, Huanglian, Huangqin, Yanhusuo, soap beans, Danggui, and frankincense (equal portions). Grind into powder, use paper to form a wick, dip it in the medicine and insert into the nose to induce a sneeze for quick effect.[209p]

　　灵砂丹御药　治风热郁结，气血蕴滞，头目昏眩，鼻塞声重，清涕口苦，舌干，咽嗌不利，胸膈痞闷，咳嗽痰实，肠胃燥濇，小便赤黄，阴虚心火炽甚，及偏正头痛，遍身麻木，疮痒，一切风证，并宜治之。　　明天麻　独活　羌活　细辛　石膏煅防风　连翘　薄荷各二两　川芎　栀子　荆芥穗　大黄生　当归　黄芩　全蝎去毒微炒　菊花　人参　白朮各五钱　甘草生　寒水石生　桔梗各二两　砂石二钱半　滑石四两　右为末，炼蜜和匀，朱砂二两为衣，每两作十丸，每服一丸，细嚼，茶清下。

Ling Sha Dan is a medicinal remedy for treating wind-heat blockage, stagnation of qi and blood, dizziness, nasal congestion with a heavy voice, clear nasal discharge with a bitter mouth, dry tongue, dysphagia, chest oppression, cough with thick phlegm, dryness and difficulty in the intestines and stomach, reddish-yellow urine, extreme yin deficiency with heart fire, as well as unilateral and bilateral headaches, general numbness, itching sores, and all wind-related ailments.

Ingredients:

  • Tian Ma, Du Huo, Qiang Huo, Xi Xin, Shi Gao (calcined), Fang Feng, Lian Qiao, Bo He (each 2 taels)
  • Chuan Xiong, Zhi Zi, Jing Jie Sui, Da Huang (raw), Dang Gui, Huang Qin, Quan Xie (detoxified and lightly roasted), Ju Hua, Ren Shen, Bai Zhu (each 5 qian)
  • Gan Cao (raw), Han Shui Shi (raw), Jie Geng (each 2 taels)
  • Sha Shi (2.5 qian), Hua Shi (4 taels)

Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with honey, and use 2 taels of Zhu Sha (cinnabar) as a coating. Make ten pills from every 2 taels, and take one pill each time, chewing it thoroughly and washing it down with clear tea.

Qing Huo Jin Zhen treats head wind, tooth pain, red eyes, brain diarrhea, and tinnitus.

Method: Use 1 tael of fire nitrates, Qing Dai, Bo He, and Chuan Xiong in equal parts, grind into powder. Hold in the mouth with cold water but do not swallow; this remedy is to be blown into the nose.

Chi Huo Jin Zhen treats the same conditions.

Method: Use 1 tael of fire nitrates, Xiong Huang, Ru Xiang, Mo Yao, Chuan Xiong, and Shi Gao (each 1 qian) along with a pair of Quan Xie, following the same method as above.[210p]

　　升气和中汤 【《宝鉴》】 　治年高气弱，清气不能上升，头昏闷，本无表邪，因发汗数次，表气愈虚，故苦头痛恶风，不喜饮食，气短，脉弱弦细而微，宜升阳气。　　黄芪钱半　人参一钱　白朮　陈皮　当归　白芍药各五分　甘草　升麻　柴胡各三分　川芎　细辛　蔓荆子各一分右口　父咀，水二盏，煎一盏，食后温服。
　　加味调中益气汤 【东垣】 　治气血两虚头痛，其效如神。　　陈皮　黄蘗酒炒，各二分　升麻　柴胡各四分　人参　甘草炙　苍朮各六分　黄芪一钱　川芎六分　细辛二分　蔓荆子三分　当归一钱　右口　父咀，水二盏，煎一盏，温服。

Shengqi Hezhong Decoction [from "Baojian"]
To treat those of advanced age with weak qi, where the clear qi cannot rise, leading to dizziness and a feeling of oppression, with no exterior pathogens involved, often exacerbated by repeated sweating; hence, the deficiency in exterior qi leads to headaches and intolerance to wind, lack of appetite, shortness of breath, and a weak, thin, and faint pulse. It is advisable to boost the yang qi.
Ingredients:

  • Astragalus (Huangqi) 1.5 qian
  • Ginseng (Renshen) 1 qian
  • Atractylodes (Baizhu) 0.5 qian
  • Dried tangerine peel (Chenpi) 0.5 qian
  • Angelica (Danggui) 0.5 qian
  • White peony (Baishao) 0.5 qian
  • Licorice (Gancao) 0.3 qian
  • Lepidium (Shengma) 0.3 qian
  • Bupleurum (Chaihu) 0.3 qian
  • Chuanxiong (Chuanqiong) 0.1 qian
  • Asarum (Xixin) 0.1 qian
  • Vitex (Manjingzi) 0.1 qian
    Prepare by grinding the above, boil with 2 cups of water until reduced to 1 cup, and take warm after meals.

Modified Tiaozhong Yiqi Decoction [from Dongyuan]
For treating headaches caused by deficiency of both qi and blood, its efficacy is miraculous.
Ingredients:

  • Dried tangerine peel (Chenpi) 0.2 qian
  • Huangbai (Huangbai) roasted 0.2 qian
  • Lepidium (Shengma) 0.4 qian
  • Bupleurum (Chaihu) 0.4 qian
  • Ginseng (Renshen) 0.6 qian
  • Licorice (Gancao) roasted 0.6 qian
  • Atractylodes (Cangzhu) 0.6 qian
  • Astragalus (Huangqi) 1 qian
  • Chuanxiong (Chuanqiong) 0.6 qian
  • Asarum (Xixin) 0.2 qian
  • Vitex (Manjingzi) 0.3 qian
  • Angelica (Danggui) 1 qian
    Prepare by grinding the above, boil with 2 cups of water until reduced to 1 cup, and take warm.

Ginseng Shunqi Powder [from "Huiren"]
To treat headaches accompanied by aversion to cold, intense heat, and limb pain.
Ingredients:

  • Ephedra (Mahuang) 1 qian
  • Kudzu root (Gankuo) 1 qian
  • Licorice (Gancao) roasted 1 qian
  • Atractylodes (Baizhu) roasted 1 qian
  • Ginseng (Renshen) 1 qian
  • Platycodon (Jiegeng) 1 qian
  • Angelica dahurica (Baizhi) 1 qian
  • Ginger (Shengjiang) roasted 0.5 qian
    Prepare by grinding the above, divide into two doses, boil with 1 cup of water, add 3 slices of ginger and 2 inches of scallion, then take while warm to induce sweating.[211p]

　　葱附丸严氏　治元气虚壅，上攻头痛。　　大附子一个，制　右为末，葱汁为丸，梧桐子大，空心茶下。

Green Onion and Aconite Pills by the Yan Family
Treats qi deficiency and blockage, causing headaches. One piece of Aconite, finely powdered, mixed with green onion juice to form pills the size of a phoenix seed, taken on an empty stomach with tea.

Angelica Wine
Treats blood deficiency with severe headaches. One ounce of Angelica, one liter of wine, boiled to obtain six portions, to be taken.

Pearl Powder
Treats wind-heat invading, causing headaches, dizziness, and nasal congestion. Seven and a half qian of sulfur, one ounce of talc, five fen of frankincense, and a small amount of borneol, ground together; use a straw to hold in the mouth and inhale through the nose.

Classic Formulas
Treats eight types of headaches.
Equal parts of Aconite and Asarum, with a small amount of yellow earth powder, finely ground; inhale through the nose for immediate effect.

Secret Recipe for Yanhusuo Paste
Treats unbearable headaches.
Ten pieces of Yanhusuo, two pieces of fatty pig's tooth soap, two qian of indigo powder, finely ground; mix with water to form small cakes the size of almonds. When needed, have the patient lie on their back, dissolve in water, and use a bamboo tube to administer into the left nostril for men or the right for women. The medicine should reach the throat and taste slightly sour. Have the patient bite down on a copper coin with the front teeth; once saliva accumulates into a basin, they will be cured.[212p]

Dingxiang San
For the treatment of persistent headaches.

  • Clove (one qian), Bai Zhi (half liang), Melon stalk (one liang). Grind them into a fine powder and blow half a character into the nose to alleviate the pain.

Ru Xiang Bing
For unbearable headache caused by Qi attacking the head.

  • Ru Xiang (one qian), castor beans (fourteen grains). Pound together to form a cake and apply it to the temples. If the pain is severe, untie the hair to release qi.

Jue Ming San
For headaches.

  • Ground Jue Ming Zi, mixed with water and applied to the temples. Another method involves using Jue Ming in a comb to relieve wind from the head and clear the eyes.

Wu Mai Bing Zi
For chronic headaches with ineffective remedies.

  • Half a jin of black wheat flour, two liang of Wu Zhu Yu, ground and mixed, formed into a cake, cooked on a hot stove. Apply it hot to the head like a hat, wrap it in thick cloth. Once the heat enters the brain and the pain stops, remove it when it cools. If not healed, replace it with a hot one; all will be cured.

  • 1 sheng of Wuzhuyu,
  • 3 liang of Ginseng,

Baihu Decoction:

  • 1.5 liang of Zhimu (with skin removed),
  • 1 liang of Licorice,
  • 1 he of Glutinous Rice,
  • 4 liang of Gypsum (grind separately for coarse powder).

Calming Spirit Powder

Astragalus, Qianghuo, and Huangbo (prepared with wine) each 1 tael; Fangfeng 2.5 qian; Zhimu (prepared with wine), Shengdi (soaked in wine), Chaihu, and Shengma each 5 qian; roasted licorice and raw licorice each 3 qian. Dongyuan and Danxi treat vacuity-heat headache, commonly using wines and various other herbal remedies.

Clear Upward Fire Decoction

In the past, there was a young person with weak qi who frequently received moxibustion at the areas of Qihai and Sanli, around fifty to seventy times. As they aged, they developed heat-related headache, and even in winter's harsh cold, they preferred cold wind. This alleviated their headache, but upon arriving in warm areas or seeing smoke and fire, the pain returned. They suffered for five to seven years without relief, an outcome of excessive moxibustion.

Qianghuo 3 qian, Zhimu (prepared with wine) and Huangqin (prepared with wine) each 1.5 qian; Astragalus, roasted licorice, and Huangbo (prepared with wine) each 1 qian; Fangfeng and Shengma each 7 fen; Chaihu 5 qian; dried root, Huanglian (prepared with wine), Shengdi, and raw licorice each 5 fen; Chuanxiong and Jingjiesui each 2 fen; Manjingezi, Cangzhu, and Danggui each 3 fen; Xixin and Honghua a pinch. Grind these into pieces the size of broad beans and divide them into two doses. For each dose, take two bowls of water and decoct until one bowl remains. Strain the dregs and take slightly warm after eating.[216p]

Tou Ding San [from Ben Shi]
Treats both partial and full head wind, including all types of head wind, regardless of duration. For Xi Xin, the white variety, three stems; seven melon tops; three cloves; seven glutinous rice grains; one black bean-sized each of brain, musk. Afterward, add them to the mortar, stir the brain and musk well, store it in a jar, and tightly close the jar. Smooth Qi and Harmonizing Decoction (from "Gangmu")
Treats headaches caused by Qi deficiency.
One and a half qian of Huangqi, one qian of Renshen, five fen each of Baizhu, Chen Pi, Danggui, and Shaoyao; three fen each of fried Gancao, Shengma, and Chaihu; two fen each of Mianjingzi and Chuanqiong; and Xixin. Boil with two cups of water until reduced to one cup, strain, and take warm after meals. Reduce the dose by half for the second serving, and it will be effective.[219p]

Jade Bottle Pill
Treats wind phlegm and counterflow, headaches, dizziness, chest distress and fullness, inability to eat, as well as excessive phlegm cough and vomiting of saliva.
Ingredients:

  • Tian Nan Xing (Rhizoma Arisaematis) 1 liang
  • Ban Xia (Pinellia Tuber) 1 liang
  • Tian Ma (Gastrodia Elata) 0.5 liang
  • Bai Mian (white flour) 3 liang

Grind the ingredients into a fine powder, form into pills the size of a Chinese parasol seed using water. Take 30 pills with 1 large cup of water; first boil the water, then add the medicine and cook for 5-7 boils; when the medicine floats, it is done. Strain and let cool, then take with ginger decoction, without regard to time. The formula also includes 5 qian of Bai Zhu (Atractylodes) and 3.5 qian of Xiong Huang (realgar), also known as Jade Bottle Pill, with the same treatment indications.

Golden Flower Pill
Treats the same indications as above.
Ingredients:

  • Nan Xing (Rhizoma Arisaematis) 1 liang
  • Ban Xia (Pinellia Tuber) 1 liang
  • Tian Ma (Gastrodia Elata) 2 qian
  • Xiong Huang (realgar) 2 qian
  • Bai Mian (white flour) 3 liang

Grind into a fine powder, form into pills, taking 50 to 100 pills. First prepare a decoction, boil the water, add the medicine until it floats, strain, and soak the extracted solution in light syrup; then take with ginger decoction. The Materia Medica includes 1 liang of roasted Han Shui Shi (Magnesia).
